Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: duboismadison
Reviews.Content: 7 night stay - from airport took spanky clean/easy to understand public bus 2E per person to Plaza Cibeles then 20 minute attractive walk to hotel (we were exhausted, with bad map & luggage -- only 15 min. on return route.) Breakfast: Plenty of places to grab good cheap food within seconds of hotel but the buffet is fabulous - endless variety of hot food (bacon! eggs!), all those hams/sausages/cheeses to sample, great coffees etc., fruit, cereals, juices, yummy bakery things - white table cloths, cozy quiet room, newspapers, cheerful staff. It will fuel you for hours of roaming Madrid. Had a big room with coffee/tea maker, fridge space in the mini-bar, long deep tub with huge separate enclosed shower that you could happily live in. Double sink. Instant hot water always (How can this be?) We like street noise so our balcony windows/doors were always open. But closed you could probably block out all sounds -- as is, it's a quiet side street. Staff on site, friendly and helpful 24hr a day. Choice of stairs or elevator. Boutique charm -- hotel pleasant to navigate up and down and out of. Absolutely would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I Didn't Want to Leave”
Reviews.Author: SpiritedWalker
Reviews.Content: After four nights in the sophisticated comforts of suite 203, I still wanted more. Although we have visited Spain twice in the past, this was the first exploration of Madrid, and we couldn't have found a more convenient or a enjoyable place to base our time in this magnificent city. We were enchanted by Madrid, and by the services, comfort, and gracious staff at Las Cortes. With a room at the front of the hotel, we did get a bit of late night noise from the street. I think that waking up under elegant, painted ceilings more than compensated for the disruptions. I'd be delighted to return anytime!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: Over all, we had a great stay in this hotel. The location is perfect, and everything is in walking distance. It is located off of Santa Ana- a cute but quiet square. The staff is very nice and the rooms are large. Hotel overall is also very pretty and the street is full of resturants and cute shops. The only complaint was that the bed was a little hard- but not so much that it cant be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel within walking distance of everything!”
Reviews.Author: sassynwugrad
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Las Cortes is an elegant boutique hotel with wonderful service in the perfect Madrid location! Our suite was elegant and spacious with separate sitting room and lovely large bathroom, king bed was enormous and comfortable with luxurious bedding, separate closet with dressing area, lovely painted ceilings make you feel as if you in medieval Madrid. The service is gracious and warm. We stayed for 2 nights traveling to South Africa and one night traveling back to the US and both times we were graciously allowed to check in early (on the way back home as early as 8:00 am without a fuss or charge). The staff is very well-trained and welcoming from the front desk to the housekeepers. The hotel is within walking distance of major sites all around including the Prado, major museums, shopping and restaurants, the Palace, and many major squares fun for walking and lunches including Plaza Mayor. It is a perfect location and you could walk everywhere safely!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for an Old Town stay”
Reviews.Author: tostrand
Reviews.Content: Hotel Catalonia Las Cortes was the perfect location for our week long stay in Madrid. It is just off the plaza of Santa Ana, and there are many great eateries within 5 minutes. It only takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Royal Palace, and even less time to walk to the Prado. The hotel itself is unobtrusive. Our room was quite large with two balconies. We were at the back of the hotel, so noise was not a problem except for Saturday night. The bathroom was very nice and modern. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bartender in particular gave us great tips about things to do and the social customs of Madrid. I would readily stay at the same hotel again if I ever return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all our boxes!”
Reviews.Author: crocettesontour
Reviews.Content: Location could not have been better for everything! The restaurants were all within walking distance to the hotel. The rooms were nice and large and spotlessly clean. Staff were fantastic and very helpful as well as informative. To TRY and find a critisism, I would have to say that the breakfast was lacking. Most of the hot food was luke-warm at best, but as it was included in our room price, no real issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...Excellent staff...Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalinSoCal
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews say it all. This hotel has everything you could want and more. Warm, welcoming staff, comfortable and spacious rooms, quiet, excellent breakfast buffet, and within walking distance to practically everything (the Prado is practically around the corner). The halls are warm and decorated with beautiful stained glass. This hotel is wonderful and an amazing value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Home Base for Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JNadaski
Reviews.Content: I cannot add to previous reviews. This place is exactly what others say. Location could not be better. Everything is within walking distance. Our room (205) was huge and, with the exception of Saturday night/Sunday morning, perfectly quiet. The only drawback would be the bar/lounge area is essentially the lobby. The staff could not be better. This hotel contributed to a truly great week in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “50 at centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Olga P
Reviews.Content: Wow what a superb hotel.It was my first trip to Madrid and I spent a long time researching the best hotel,best value for money and best location. This hotel ticked all my boxes.It looked on line to be an old hotel but in actual fact it is new and very attractive.We were given an excellent welcome and I mentioned after seeing our room that I wondered if there was a choice. I was swiftly brought to view another room which I loved and we were moved there promptly. The amusing thing was that my wife preferred the first room which she told me later.She found the mattress a little hard but there again she is a princess. She would have liked a tea making facility but actually she managed well with wine and we didnt spend much time in the hotel as we were in walking distance of metro, attractions and shops. The hotel attends to detail and as I was celebrating an occasion they planned a little surprise for me. We picked very local old restaurants to eat in and avoided the ones with the pictures of food.The restaurants that the madrid born and breed eat in and we loved the value and the food.We would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a great location. Nice accommodations, good price!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHero13
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this hotel for the price. Great location, good service, and nice rooms. Skip the breakfast in the hotel-many great nearby cafes for much cheaper cost. I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel, and I can be very picky If you read my other reviews. I believe my room rate was around $185 for a double-no breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our aniversary and it was well worth it. We loved the room, service and staff. I would have loved to have stayed here for a month. Excellent!! Stayed June 2011, travelled as a couple

Reviews.Title: “hotel great, booking service hopeless”
Reviews.Author: jez200 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: easy to book? Well, this .com was the one which didn't book at all. We arrived for our 3 night stay in Madrid at the lovely Las Cortes hotel, in a great part of town, only to find that they had no record of us. Lucky we had a printed out confirmation. Obviously it could have been the hotel's fault and not easy to book . com, but the hotel seemed as bemused as we were, and given the rest of the quality of their service, I'd be surprised to find out it was them at fault. The Las Cortes is really nice. It's in the heart of everything in Madrid, but is a little oasis away from any noise outside. Our first room had the noise inside, unfortunately, but after the first night of listening to what sounded like a train passing through our room every 30 minutes, we asked to be moved and promptly were. Again, great service from the front desk, all of whom were most accommodating and friendly, not even minding our terrible attempts at Spanish. In our second room we settled in quickly to the great facilities and excellent quality of the accommodation. Couldn't fault it, and this time no train noise. Avoid 417!! It's next to the lift, but we worked out by going up and down in it that it wasn't that that was causing the noise. And the front desk had no idea either. All in all, a really good place to stay when you're in Madrid, just as long as the room is carefully chosen!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Ann728
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of museums,plazas,art galleries etc.Close to lots of tapas bars, good restaurants and bars.Elegant rooms lovely green marble bathroom.Staff friendly really enjoyed four night stay .

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We like the area, but were unfamiliar with the hotel. Saw the good reviews in TripAdvisor and decided to give it a shot. Good move. The location is fantastic, close to both the Prado and the Plaza de Santa Ana, where there are numerous tapas bars. The room was not large, but was elegant and faced the street. No noise though, due to double-pained windows. The bathroom was huge and elegant. I was nervous about comments about hard mattresses. The beds were firm, but I had a good night's sleep every night. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. I was a bit apprehensive, as we were there for 5 nights, due to an annual business trip, but was not at all disappointed. Didn't have a breakfast plan, but there are several options very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: RuiAna_ptbr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only and I can only tell this hotel has a really convenient location, near the parliament and the museums quarter, as well as not far from Parque del Retiro or the Atocha station. The room was quite clean, staff was helpful and breakfast was varied and of good quality. On such a short stay, I'd say this is what you can ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday EVER”
Reviews.Author: 24JessicaW
Reviews.Content: I had the best EVER 21st Birthday. AMAZING location, you can walk everywhere! No need for the underground-AT ALL! Great service. The price for this hotel is superb! I dare you to try and find better in Madrid. The only thing I was dissapointed at was the 'Triple' room. 2 single beds and a camp bed for 3 adults is not good enough. My sisters feet dangled off the edge! Will add photo's later! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MugEsen
Reviews.Content: Besides the central location, the thing I likes most about Hotel Catalonia Las Cortes is its ambiance. You feel like you are in a room of a historical palace. Rooms are traditional but new. Staff is friendly. Wi-fi is available and free. Worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel :o)”
Reviews.Author: rap100r
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Madrid last night, after staying at the Catalonia Las Cortes Hotel. It was a beautiful hotel, we were given one of the most sumptuous rooms we have ever had the pleasure of staying in (and at a really good price too). The room was enormous and luxurious, with a large 'warm' bathroom, they even had tea & coffee making facilities in the room (not something we find often in Spain). To top it all off, the staff were lovely, they were pleasant and professional and nothing was to much trouble for them. The location is also great, its right in the middle of all the bars and shops, there is a Theatre just around the corner and a varied array of Tapas and wine bars. We visited a little Columbian bar, where the locals were all singing and dancing into the small hours, and then visited some rather chic wine bars, we had a fantastic time. We cant wait until we return later this year, Madrid is incredible...Oh and the people are some of the most friendly we have ever come across :o)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyCG
Reviews.Content: Having been to Spain a few times before, I love the country but have never really had any fantastic hotel experiences, so I suppose my expectations were a bit lower than usual. We chose Catalonia Las Cortes because the price was right, the location is perfect for Old Madrid - half way between the Plaza Mayor and the Prado - and because of good reviews on Trip Advisor. We're very happy that we stayed there. Most of our interactions with staff were friendly and helpful. We took a suite and it was large and comfortable. The bed was especially large (although it might have been nice to have a few extra blankets in the cupboard), and the whole room was beautiful - stained glass windows in the corridor, beautiful ceilings and everything looked great. Did I mention that it's about 20 metres from Plaza Santa Ana?

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Steve N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in January and found the hotel to be great for our needs. We booked the standard double for 110 euros per night and found this to be excellent value. The room was a good size, clean, with a good standard bathroom and a very large double bed. I found the reception area disappointing, rather small and uninspiring. I had the same impression of the small bar and sitting area. We declined the 16 euro per head and I am pleased we did. A big city like Madrid has so much to offer in terms of bars, cafes and restaurants it seems a watse of appetite to eat a hotel breakfast. Naturally we also spent much less than 16 euros each, but that's not really my point. Despite the underwhelming public space we would definitely return to this hotel when we come back in October

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JenziWanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife loved the rooms, location and service. She generally so critical, esp., when I do the trip planning. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “great location superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluecornIreland
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful stay in this hotel for 4 nights over christmas period .you will be pushed to find a better location as this is in the middle of everything.Calle de las huertas is a street parrallel and turn left at the front door, you are looking at plaza santa ana.We were on the fifth floor and had a fabulous room with a large bed.It felt like a small apartment rather than a double room actually,and was so quiet at night for a hotel in the middle of the city.The hotel is small /some would describe as boutique style,tastefully decorated with beautiful furnishings on all floors including stunning stain glass windows.We didnt eat at the hotel and breakfast was not included in our deal (16€ a bit pricey) but there are so many cafes ,bars minutes down the street that we were spoiled for choice and most cost about ten euros for the two of us.have stayed in other central madrid hotels and this was the best.terrific staff always willing to help.The prado/parc de la retiro ten mins walk away as is sofia reina and puerta del sol / plaza mayor....cant ask for any more than that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: karenfrost
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. The staff were so kind and had upgraded us to a lovely room on our arrival wishing him Happy Birthday The room was spacious and clean and we slept very comofortaby. The bathroom had a huge bath and seperate double shower The building is a restored palace and it certainly feels palatial. The staircase is stunning, its worth exploring parts of the building outside of your room. The location is perfect. Everything is on the doorstep or walkable easily. We stayed room only so i cant comment on the food or restaurant (croissant and coffee can be bought easily for a couple of euro each at one of the abundance of small bars/ eateries that line the streets. Drinks in the hotel bar were very reasonably priced (3 euro for large Riocha) as was the mini bar Wouldnt stay anywhere else if we return to Madrid. Great stay

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room and perfect location,”
Reviews.Author: Bonnyblink
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on a street just off Plaza Santa Ana which is a hub for bars and restaurants yet the hotel is very quiet; we had an internal room and heard nothing. The musuem Reina Sofia is within easy walking distance in one direction and Plaza Major is easily reached in the opposite direction. We used the metro to get to this hotel. When we got off the metro it was a five minute walk but if it's a weekend night it would be difficult to work your way through the crowds with a suitcase in tow. A taxi cost our friends 30 Euros. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and the bathroom was large with a bath and separate shower. Breakfast was a pleasant experience with typical spanish meats, cheeses, cereals, fruits and breads. All-in-all, the location and peaceful sleep make for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AuntMom
Reviews.Content: We do travel a lot, and enjoy good hotels. This is the most beautiful room we have slept in! Angels watching over us in our huge bed, in a really large room containing antique furniture. In the hallway there are stained glass paintings, and it is a marvellous athmosphere all over the place. Stay here while in Madrid! Friendly and helpful staff, really good location to shopping or galleries or whatever you are interested in. Roomservice is good, and friendly prizes. We`d love to come back...to room 202...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hyariv
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on travelers reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel is perfectly located, walking distance from most of Madrid highlights. The area is lovely, crowded with people hanging out at bars, restaurants and cafés. The room (202) was very big, clean and comfortable and the hotel itself elegant. I must add that all though we booked the room for four nights, We arrived a day later then scheduled and the hotel was more then fair to charge us for three nights only. All in all we were very pleased

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Extrememly good location”
Reviews.Author: mayankak
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel while surfing through trip advisor itself. It was a beautiful small hotel with clean and good rooms very comfortable for 3 people. Initially we had a problem with the room service but after a small complaint everything was taken care of, the staff is extremely hospitable and friendly especially the front desk staff and even the Manager. The room and hotel is complete value for money and infact there are better shopping areas near this hotel than the main area Gran Via. Totally recommended hotel and I hope it does keep everyone happy the way it kept us.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: catorange
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful and spacious. The bed was very large. Loved the comfortable chairs and tables by the door/window. It was nice to sit there and feel the breeze. Very clean hotel. Lots of closet space. Ladies you will like to know that the bathroom was very pretty and clean. Walking distance from many attractions. Restaurants near: you must try the French restaurant Casanis which is about a 3 minute walk & La Mucca which is also about a 3 minute walk. The staff are friendly and helpful in the hotel. I enjoyed sitting in the lobby/bar having a cocktail. The hotel is decorated with beautiful rich colors. Very romantic place. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, Great Location, Wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: JGreg61
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just steps away from St. Ana's plaza, and 5 minute from the Puerta del Sol or the Prada museum (take a left from the entrance to the parties, take a right to the arts). We got a suite, and it's amazing. It appears to be a converted 18th century library or dining hall. The marble bathroom has a whirlpool tub and a separate shower. A little noisy, and the staff are typically Spanish...not rude but rather indifferent. Room 104 is a gem and this hotel is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: VickiD
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It was one of the nicest we stayed at in Spain with a very comfortable, firm bed in a lovely and quiet room. The bathroom and a full bath with shower plus a second shower stall. Be sure to forgo the elevator and check out the beautiful old wood staircase and you will find stunning stained glass in sitting areas. The location cannot be beat, a short walk to the Prado and the Palace and the Plaza Major and in the heart of the restaurant district. We were a 15 minute walk to the airport bus, which saved us a 35 Euro taxi ride. Staff were all super helpful. You can't go wrong with this great hotel!! I should add that the price for this hotel was only 106 Euro per night. I would have expected it to be at least 50% more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: bailyhowth
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a 3 night stay at this great hotel. Stayed in room 107 and despite it being on the 1st floor and facing out onto a side street we heard no noise unlike other reviewers. The room whilst smallish made up on size by the fab bathroom. The hotel is so clean, bed hard but very comfortable, reception staff very friendly and helpful. Bar staff equally nice. I was expecting a cold reception but found the total opposite. Did not bother with breakfast which is pricey at €16 per head - plenty of places nearby - €10 for 2. Bar prices are very reasonable - enjoyed coffee and also a few drinks there on our last night. Do try the restaurant at the lower end of this street - junction of first turn to the right walking down - brillant restaurant - book first. Also enjoyed The Turf in plaza santa anna but avoid the bar on the top right hand side of the square as you walk up from the hotel - rip off! City is amazing place. I would def come back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location, value, comfort”
Reviews.Author: toalt2
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in October and were not disappointed. In fact, you would really have to sell me to stay elsewhere. The location could not be beat - near Plaza Santa Ana with great restaurants, but not noisy - and short walk to everything else! Never took a taxi! The room was large for our party of 3, with huge bathroom, and very clean and in good repair. The beds were hard as mentioned by many. The reception was fine, but not overly helpful. Loved our stay here and thought it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquile spot in the city center”
Reviews.Author: WestendCPH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the right place if you want to pamper yourself when in Madrid. Catalonia Las Cortes is placed close to Sol and the main shopping area. Just outside the hotel there are plenty of restaurants - the Tapas Maze. The staff at Catalonia Las Cortes is very friendly and welcoming. The rooms quite big, well equiped and nice decorated. Wardrobes which are illuminated inside - liked that very much. Free safe. Small balcony. Nice double bed. Big bathroom with free toiletries. Shower and bathtub. Only turn down was the extra blankets which were full of spots.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl1969
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment, i did so much research before booking this hotel. Myself, my husband and my son were given a room on the 5th floor with no ventilation, we needed to use air conditioning all the time. The feeling in the room was quite claustrophic. The matresses were the hardest i ever tried to sleep on. Staff were not really interested when i told them how disappointed i was and went on to attempt to overcharge me by e100 on checkout. No windows in hotel. Only two positives were location and breakfast, though breakfast was definitely not worth e16. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seawaves
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel has nothing of a Palace in it, but the rooms do show luxury. The location is again in a narrow lane and the windows open to other buildings around you, thereby giving no view. Rooms and Bathroom are both quite good. Staff is welcoming . Location is quite central in the sense of close to Mayors Plaza and the Palace. The hotel has a Cuban restaurant opposite to it and many other eateries along the same lane. There is a large square close to the hotel, which becomes very lively in the evenings with Al Fresco Diners and beer drinkers. The place is full of rythim with tourist till very late in the night and is dotted with many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for 1st time visitor: good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BowenLinda
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights in October 2011 at the Catalonia Las Cortes, and enjoyed it. I paid E100 and E120 per night. This was my first visit to Spain, and I travelled solo. The hotel is a renovated 18th c. palace and is well decorated and maintained. My twin bed room was located on the 4th floor, on the rear side of the hotel, and was large, as was the marble bathroom. A firm mattress but that didn't stop me sleeping. Double French doors to the Juliet balcony provided great noise-proofing (and a charming view) for the very late-night Madrileno crowd and the "Occupy" protest march, and the AC worked well. Didn't eat or drink at the hotel so can't comment there. For a first time visitor, the location is fantastic and I felt safe (although I wasn't wandering about at 1 or 4 am). Less than half a block from Plaza Santa Ana and about 2 1/2 blocks to the Prado Museum and everything in that neighbourhood. Can walk to Antioch rail station as well, which I did to buy tickets; wouldn't necessarily recommend walking on the uneven stone with a rolling suitcase. Things I noted: although the reception staff was helpful, they do not substitute for concierge service in this 4 * hotel, and there are no clocks in the rooms (or any room in Spain I stayed at). Would definitely recommend the Catalonia for a first time visitor and I would consider it for a second visit (although I like to stay in new areas). I stayed at the Catalonia Moratin on C. Antioch on the evening before my early morning flight home. Very friendly and helpful staff (more so than the Las Cortes), large room and bath again not quite as nicely decorated as the Las Cortes, and E75. A very slightly iffy neighbourhood but lots of people wandering about. I would stay there again to enjoy a last few hours of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MenloMichael
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location -- near many sights, restaurants, and Metro lines. Friendly and efficient staff with a "customer is always right" attitude. See "room tips" below. The Superior rooms have beautiful decor. Also see my review of a nearby great restaurant, Casanis: http://www.tripadvisor.com/Restaurant_Review-g187514-d2101677-Reviews-Casanis_Madrid-Madrid.html Note that there are plenty of nice restaurants on Ventura de la Vega, about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in and Excellent Location -Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OceanForceMiami
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel last minute on Trip Advisor and were more than pleasently surprised at how much we received for the moderate price. It is centrally located but on a quiet and charming sidestreet leading to most of the main areas. Palace Real and Plaza Mayor just a short walk as well as Sophia and Prado. The high-ceiling rooms were large and well appointed with just enough amenities to make you feel as though you might be in a pricier hotel. The hotel's staff went out of their way to ensure we had anything we requested. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone wanting a higher end feeling at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Location is as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: LosAbuelos
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nites in late October weather was good for three days and a little rain on the fourth day. The location of the hotel is as good as it gets. Two steps from the Plaza Santa Ana, as series of plaza's all the way to the Plaza Mayor. 5 Minutes down the hill to the Prado & Thyssen, Restaurantes all around strongly recommend "Casanis" about a block away on Ventura de la Vega 9. Breakfast at the hotel is pricey, lots more inexpensive close by. The location and helpful staff make it a good choice

Reviews.Title: “perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: GoulashCrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and we LOVED this hotel. We opted for a room with 1 bed, and it turned out to be a king size bed which seems unheard of in Europe. The bath amenities included soap, shampoo and body wash but not conditioner, a shoe shine sponge, a comb, and a shower cap. The shower/tub worked well. What was most amazing is how quiet the room was considering it is right in the middle of the central city. The 2 euro bus from the airport stops at Cibeles which is a 10 min walk to the hotel. We walked to the Prado and Thyssen museums, the Royal Palace (my favorite), the Trocha train station (to see the nice tropical garden inside), and Retiro Park. We found a tiny bakery around the corner on Calle de Leon with great cafe leche and pastries for breakfast. A french restaurant called Casanis Madrid, and a tapas bar called Lateral, were our favorite meals, but we weren't impressed with restaurant La Catedral. A nice place for drinks and people-watching is Estado Puro next to Starbucks at Neptune Fountain. San Miguel market was an interesting but crowded spot for a snack. Maison de Jamon in Plaza Mayor has an incredible deal with a ham croissant with cheese and tomato for only one euro. This and other plazas have cafes to sit and have a drink and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Marqc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre of Madrid not far from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. I enjoyed 2 quiet nights despite my room being on 1st floor on the street side. The room and the bathroom were both very clean. The bed mattress was a bit too hard. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of food and drinks. My only real complain is related to the WiFi which didn't work very well in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: robwh
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located within walking distance of most sights in old area if Madrid. Travelling solo means a single room and my room was very small with no space to open bags as there were 2 very large chairs taking valuable floor space. The bed was VERY hard. But - the bathroom was clean and well appointed. No view from the room and I needed to run the a/c for ventilation even though it was not hot. The breakfast was good but they need to get a toaster that does the job. I enjoyed the location which was close to Santa Ana Plaza where you could have great tapas and meals. It would be great if more hotels in Europe would provide tea and coffee facilities in the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: moxieandgiggi
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, good price at $138. It is on a narrow lane a few yards from Santa Ana plaza, a lively square with cafes and clubs, but the hotel is far enough away to be quiet for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Oliviamouse
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel - the location, the staff, the gorgeous drapes and bedspread in our room, and especially the little outdoor room downstairs where we could chat with our smoking friends and get drinks from the bar late at night. This was the nicest hotel of my trip to France and Spain - also the most expensive, but there are good deals online and it was definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jdoehler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel; smoke-free; large rooms (both bedroom and bath); very clean. Courteous, helpful, and friendly staff at the front desk. Conveniently located within walking distance to everything - the Prado (and other museums); Puerta del Sol (the Times Square of Madrid), the Metro, etc. Also - walking distance to many tapas bars, Plaza Santa Ana, Plaza Mayor - yet tucked away on a quiet cobblestone side street in Madrid. Highly recommended !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Prado & Comfortable too!”
Reviews.Author: JPSWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This is the PERFECT place to stay in Madrid if your goal is to see the Prado. All of the museums were a short walk away and we loved the convenience to cafes and restaurants too. Upon arrival, we really appreciated the early check in and thought the staff was very helpful. One staff gave us a great restaurant recommendation for authentic paella. The room was clean and quiet. The breakfast buffett was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but service could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights at this hotel which, as others have said, is in a very convenient location. Our room overlooked a side street and was blissfully quiet. The room itself was comfortable, attractive, modern and well decorated. It lacked storage space and the toiletries were mediocre and were not always replenished. The staff at reception were pleasant and helpful when asked, but volunteered little. At check-in, for example, they offered no information regarding the hotel or its surroundings except the times for breakfast. No help with suitcases was offered. An American electrical connector could not be provided. Breakfast was very good with a selection ranging from cereals, juices and baked goods to bacon and eggs. Public areas of the hotel are most attractive with a superb staircase. No English-language newspapers were available.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing amazing amazing”
Reviews.Author: anissa96
Reviews.Content: Spent my birthday here with my fiance and had a lovely time. The location is spectacular with almost immediate accessiblility to Plaza Santa Ana, Plaza Mayor, and Sol. The staff took the fact that it was my birthday into consideration and may have upgraded us to a suite (I couldn't tell if it was a standard room or not, but it was really lovely and comfortable and spacious). The rate was probably a bit higher than something else could have gotten for the comparable time period, but it was beyond well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at a good price”
Reviews.Author: judyineaston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice - at the beginning and at the end of our trip. Lovely, well furnished, very clean and comfortable rooms at a very reasonable price for a big city. Quiet - no noise from the inside or outside. Well air conditioned - while it needs a room card to run , it cools down quickly on your return, even on the very hot days - mid to high 90's - we experienced in Madrid. Large bathrooms with lots of hot water and good showers. Very well located - near the Prado and Atchoa train stations. Close to the Plaza Santa Ana where you have a choice of a number of open air restaurants with good food. Staff is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Lou Ann G
Reviews.Content: Even nicer than the pictures, large public areas, and helpful staff. Very comfortable rooms, and great location in middle of Madrid. Was very pleased to get such nice accommodations at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location for the money”
Reviews.Author: stubenposters
Reviews.Content: On our last visit to Madrid we stayed in the Villa Real, arguably one of the city's most luxurious, best-located and expensive hotels. This time we stayed a block and a half away at the Catalonia Las Cortes for a fraction of the price. Nice room, huge bath, interesting architecture, friendly staff, what's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jessie189
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights. The location is excellent --less than a 10 minute walk to the Prado and surrounded by unique shops and lots of tabernas wine bars, and restaurants The staff is friendly and hard working. The room was very elegant with a large marble bathroom that had both a stall shower and a bathtub with a shower. The double windows ensured that the room was quiet. We loved the bountiful buffet breakfast that was a good value at 8 euro per person. Our only gripe is that the bed was very hard --certainly not what you would expect at a 4 star hotel. We managed without complaining because everything else about the property is so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, stylish and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chucklegoddess
Reviews.Content: This place is perfectly placed to enjoy the best of Madrid. Just down from the popular Santa Ana plaza it is just fab. There was not one thing I could fuss about ( and I am very fussy!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property; superb location”
Reviews.Author: pasadena4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights in early August and could not have been more pleased with our overall stay. Although it had been many years since I have lived in Madrid as a college student, I was familiar with the Plaza Santa Ana adjacent to the hotel and its proximity to all of the major art museums and great restaurants in the city. Our room was large, immaculate and quiet with high ceilings, a minibar and writing desk. The public areas of the hotel were also beautiful and well maintained. The marble bathroom was quite large by European standards. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Louise_B558
Reviews.Content: Really central hotel, Just a stones throw from everything. The staff were so helpful and the room lovely. It was my boyfriends birthday and so they gave us a room with the only balcony in the hotel. My boyfriend was desperate to watch the world cup on tv, the staff did everything they could to find out where he could view it. Go to the flea market on Sunday, very busy but great atmosphere, within walking distance of most things.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tripaddict28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely - beautiful decor, large rooms and bathrooms and very central. Very close to Plaza Santa Ana with lovely restaurant choices and close to all other major sights - Opera House, Palace, Puerto del Sol, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a perfect hotel to stay in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: cihan35
Reviews.Content: I was surprized when I saw the hotel and the room because it is better than most of the 5 star hotels across europe.Very large rooms , with high ceilings.You can not stay in such kind of a hotel with that price.The location is perfect; 5-10 minutes walk to most of the attractive places like Plaza Mayor , Palacio Real , Prado Museum , Gran Via and Puerta Del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “A great location; strongly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: courtenay37
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and were delighted with our choice. We had a triple superior room which was ideal for my wife, daughter and me. The location is very convenient, in the old part of the city and within walking distance of most tourist destinations, and there are lots of excellent tapas bars nearby. Although our room looked over the narrow street, it was very quiet and we slept well. There is a good coffee shop down the street, where we enjoyed continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Showbizz
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. We had a fantastic room. The staff were lovely. Highly recommended! Note: we did room only so can't comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel! Would absolutely return! Clean, friendly, very central location!”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey L
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Agoda travel planning and got an excellent rate. For the price we payed we were scared what the hotel would be like but it turned out to be excellent! Large, spacious room and bathroom. AC that worked well (it's hot in August). EXTREMELY friendly and helpful staff! The hotel is walking distance to just about everything you want to see. Very close (1 block) to one of the main Plaza's that had lots of nice restaurants. Daily room service... Honestly cannot say enough good things about thsi hotel. I did a lot of researching before choosing a hotel and could not have been more satisfied... if I were to go back I would absolutely stay there again. Stop looking at reviews and choose this hotel! You will not be disappointed. Hotel is also in a quiet location. Barcelona and Madrid never sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, comfortable beds, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: joanp
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the places we wanted to visit-- Reina Sofia Museum, Prado, Buen Retiro Park and even to the train station (for our day trip to Toledo). Rooms were typically small European size but comfortable and attractively styled. Good restaurants within a block in either direction, a late-night bodega around the corner and a laundromat too (which we used). Also the hotel is near main roads, but on a relatively quiet side street and our rooms were really quiet, which was important to us. Breakfast selection was more than ample and high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning room, fantastic location, brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pennydoctor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in August 2011. Our room was stunning (102, huge, our own pillars and ceiling fresco!) - probably one of the best we have stayed in. The location can't be beaten in central Madrid (quiet but easy walking distance to main sites). The value was amazing even without a free additional bed for our 10 year old. Only downsides were car parking - local public car park is a steep 28 euros a day - and aircon underpowered for enormous room

Reviews.Title: “A nice find. Good Value but...”
Reviews.Author: Chavetto
Reviews.Content: Great location. Close to cool restaurants, a metro stop and Plaza Del Sol. Clean boutique hotel with some character. We got a great deal on the room but we did not eat anything nor have a drink here because the prices were outrageous. Even the mini bar was surprisingly much more expensive than any other Hotel on our trip. This Hotel had great, free, WiFi but don't expect to use a house computer for free. You have to swipe your credit card. You are better off finding the internet cafe around the corner that charges a fraction of what they want to charge you. No big deal. I still would recommend. P.S. The bed was HUGE! A rarity for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lsharpe79
Reviews.Content: Good Location, within walking distance of the main areas of interest. The hotel is clean and pleasant, and the breakfast included was good and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quietly elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezm785
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights in July. The hotel rooms were very large (by comparison to most European hotels), and very well priced. The hotel was clean and extremely well managed. I had virtually no street noise, but a couple of nights there were young teens-early 20s, who were in a group and partying. So, this was not the hotel's fault, as they couldn't stop all the activity and people going in and out. The 5th floor is your best bet for quiet, in the case of noisy neighbors, being that it has the fewest number of rooms and is divided into 2 sections. The staff was gracious and helpful. I didn't eat the breakfasts, as I tried a different local breakfast place in the area each day. I would highly recommend the hotel---when I double checked, most of the hotels in the area are priced significantly higher. I had great comfort, in an excellent neighborhood, for my entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, beautiful rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: pitzi_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights, starting 28 June. Everything was excellent---spacious and very clean room, good service (every little thing we asked for was immediately taken care of), very good location, close to Piazza Santa Ana, but also very quiet. will definitely come back only to this hotel !!Excellent service at the reception too. They did their best to enable a late checkout, as we had a medical problem. Especially Vanessa was attentive and helpfull. (doesn"t mean others were not, just I remember her especially) Thanks and see you soon !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every respect”
Reviews.Author: boswash
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, excellent staff, perfect location in the middle of everything yet on a quiet street, decent price for Madrid, can't say enough good things about it. We will not stay anywhere else in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuitcasesPacked
Reviews.Content: Plus Convenient location Safe Quiet Near nice plaza for dining Helpful staff Easy walk to major tourist sights Clean Challenge bed a little hard Internet spotty in room, especially on weekend Just FYI Several block walk from airport bus and train Popular with American tourists. Staff speak English

Reviews.Title: “On a quick day trip and this hotel fit our needs PERFECTLY”
Reviews.Author: purplebluejay
Reviews.Content: We were only in town for one day and we were able to fit in everything that we wanted to do. This hotel was perfectly located. It is within walking distance to both the Palace and the Prado. It is not situated "in the thick of it" but I found that to be wonderful. The area along the way to the palace is very commercial, loud and touristy. Very fun to walk through on our way back to our quiet spacious hotel room. The staff was very friendly. I was expecting another dose of Spanish surliness but was very pleased with the warmth of the staff. The room was expertly appointed with a sitting area, huge bed, great water pressure, minibar and was very quiet even though our room faced the street. The bed was firm but that seems be common in Europe. Everything else made up for it. After a busy day of sightseeing we were able to take a rest, get freshened up and go out for dinner. All without taking a single cab. **hint** the airport bus stop is within walking distance. The front desk was kind enough to share this information. It saved us ~20E.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Richard3359
Reviews.Content: Great location as near plaza Santa ana which is a great base to be at. The hotel is a luxury hotel yet doesn't have the lack of individuality that the sheratons and hiltons miss out in. Awesome room as we had the suite with a large room with 2 lcd's and large marble bathroom and jacuzzi baths. The room is individually themed with hand painted ceilings and luxury throughout. Also staff are friendly yet not too intimidating. The only small point was seeing front desk staff smoking outside the reception. This may be due to in the uk smoking is now seem as a taboo yet here it is more tolerated. Apart from this small point a fantastic hotel with bespoke Individual boutique luxury and would return and reccomend the property. Well done!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Hotel and Room”
Reviews.Author: ChargerDriver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was once a palace and, in many ways, it is still quite palatial. We had a beautiful room - marble entry, hardwood floors, marble bath. The ceilings in the bedroom are quite high and the furnishings are sumptious - absolutely grand. The staff was very helpful. If I had one issue, it would be that the bar wasn't open until approximately 6 pm. Other than that, I can highly recommend the Catalonia Las Cortes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pashchom
Reviews.Content: Highly practical, though not charming or very personal. The location perfect. The rooms are clean, big, and very quiet. There's an option for a late check out that is worth every penny (40 euros) if the weather is hot, and you have a late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_traveller123
Reviews.Content: Rooms were decent sized and very nicely decorated. We had requested two rooms side by side and they did their best to accommodate us. Also the front desk staff in general was extremely helpful - with regards to giving us directions, helping us make reservations, suggestions on what to see etc. We took their breakfast offer (they had a special price promotion) and loved the breakfast. However, they do seem a bit understaffed - particularly at the breakfast. We had two people who seemed rather overwhelmed with the work - seating people, setting up tables, making sure the buffet items were replenished and bringing pots of hot water for tea as well as refilling coffee - it just seemed extremely inefficient. Another point worth considering is that there is a bar of some kind in the alley next to the hotel which can get rather noisy at night - so you will have to make sure your windows/doors are closed if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: OldBlueDoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two days on our way to Valencia (business) and Barcelona (vacation), based on trip advisor recommendation. It met our needs perfectly--good location near the Prado, quiet, inexpensive, quaint but with all modern conveniences, friendly staff. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Best In Madrid”
Reviews.Author: WaitingtoWarmUp
Reviews.Content: Stay here! Perfect location (right near the park and the Prado) with very cute rooms. While the party is raging outside the double paned windows keep it quiet inside. The beds were comfy and the front desk staff was very nice. Great deal for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: jde1776
Reviews.Content: Eight nights here, and we were very favorably impressed. Staff is excellent and very professional; rooms, beds, and bathrooms were clean and comfortable; some outside street noise but bearable with the double windows; and a location that can't be beaten--just a few steps to the Plaza Santa Ana, or, in the other direction, to the Prado and Retiro Park and everything else. Tapas bars in every direction--we just couldn't stop eating and drinking! We walked everywhere in the old section of Madrid, and the staff was helpful in setting up a day trip to Toledo. Breakfast, at 10 euros, was excellent. We will stay here again on our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: thereset Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy walk to main galleries and plazas. Our rooms were very quiet, comfortable and tastefully equipped. Breakfasts were excellent and staff were charming. What else could we want ?

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSwiss
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid for the week-end and spent two night at Catalonia Las Cortes. The location of the hotel is great, about 5-10mins walk from the Prado Museum and about 2 mins from Plaza Santa Ana (a trendy plaza with many cafes, bars and restaurants). While it remains in a touristic area (the old city), it is still relatively quiet and one can still enjoy the charm of the local culture and it is not in the MOST touristic area. And as the other reviews mention, all main places to visit are within walking distance. It is also located on a small street which is nice as there is not too much noise at night. The room was amazing and huge. There was also a beautiful marble bathroom. We stayed in room 403 and I would recommend this room to anyone as it was on a high enough level for the noise level on Friday night to be almost inexistant despite the partying on the street. All in all, very clean, very friendly staff and helpful for any request and amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Choice by Trip Advisor was correct.”
Reviews.Author: asorrell
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel now and will stay for a total of five nights. We selected it because reviews mentioned it was quiet. it is but the hotel is also well located with most museums and attractions within easy walks. The room has double glazing to a small balcony overlooking a pedestrian street. The staff are friendly and generous with their help.Good sized safe, bathroom with shower over bath. Wifi in room and seems reliable. At the rate we are paying it is a strong recommend. Ate out so no news on food etc. Breakfast buffet was E10 per head. No pool but a spa untried.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBAinItaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in May during a long visit to Spain: first by myself for one night and then again with my husband and son. Both visits were consistent and terrific. On the first visit I was coming directly from a nasty hotel in Barcelona. I had booked a single through Booking.com and I got lucky with an upgraded room (402). It was so spacious, with a huge bathroom, comfortable seating, fresh new decor and furnishings, a pretty window balcony overlooking the street, and spotless! Compared to the dump I had just left, imagine my delight! I made a point of thanking the front desk for the upgrade and arranged for a similar room for "part two" of our trip with the family. It was also just perfect. The location was great; just down from the very nice Plaza Santa Ana and an easy walk to Plaza Mayor, the museum triangle, etc. The neighborhood was clean and pretty. The service was flawless, from the front desk to the cocktail bar to the room service team to the security guard/doorman who helped me get early morning taxis (very easy, by the way). They also have a great map of Madrid--it's small and fits easily into a pocket instead of being one of those gargantuan maps with all the advertising around it. Really a nice touch for its convenience! They have free wifi in the lobby areas (and maybe in the rooms) but you have to pay for internet access if you want to use the hotel's lobby computer. I saw lots of travellers using the iPads and laptops. Considering the price point of this hotel, I think it's an awesome value. We will make it our home base when we come back to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “TRULY EXCEPTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTourist2008
Reviews.Content: All the rave reviews this hotel are richly deserved. Very centrally located. Ideal in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Doesnt live up to it's trip advisor rating - won't be going back!”
Reviews.Author: tabby761
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel...we booked a triple room and were given a very small room with two double beds pushed together and a single fold out bed. There was no room for the single fold out bed so they put it in front of the wardrobe doors meaning we couldnt use the wardrobe without hoisting the bed out of the way each time. Plus the base of the bed was marked, dirty and torn with foam hanging out. I wasnt happy that my 14 yr old had to sleep in it. As we'd arrived in the early hours of the morning and were tired, we didnt say anything that night but the next morning we complained and they moved us to a bigger room. Despite me asking for 3 'proper' beds as they were advertising it as a triple room and them telling me there were and there wasnt a fold out bed, there was a fold out bed. But at least it was cleaner and there was room for it. The only downside to this room (103) was that it was directly above the two sliding doors of the main entrance so until late at night and from early in the morning (about 6.30am) the noise of the doors was almost constant and woke us up. As for the breakfasts....stone cold every morning! Not even barely warm....so not great having stone cold eggs and bacon. I told the receptionist that they needed a new heating system for the food as the present one wasnt working. She discounted the breakfasts from the bill and gave us 10% discount on the room. This was fine but didnt make up for the uncomfortable stay - we wont be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in the Catalonia Las Cortes - the room was fabulous! Huge, beautifully decorated room, with enough room for 2 adults and 2 kids, and a gorgeous bathroom. The hotel is right next to one of the best squares in Madrid - just a wonderful location. Its also close to the metro stations. The staff seemed very friendly, gave as good restaurant recommendations. Overall, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sierra015
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Las Cortes is a great hotel, and my grown son and I greatly enjoyed our stay there at the end of May, 2011. Madrid was our final stop of a whirlwind trip of 4 Spanish cities, and it was wonderful to find a large and spacious room, and humongous bathroom, as we really needed to spread out and relax after many exhausting and action-packed days. Our twin beds were comfortable, and the bathroom so large we had both a walk-in shower stall AND bathtub/shower combo, plus a large counter with basin. Our room was down a short hall in a corner on the third floor, and it was quiet and peaceful, although our balcony opened out onto the street below. Such a treat, really. The breakfast was good, not great, but certainly adequate, and included cereal, fruit, smoked meats, eggs, pastries, breads, etc. Great coffee! The hotel itself is handsome--a blend of old Spain and contemporary amenities--and is in a fabulous location. It is very close to El Prado and the Botanic Gardens, and is also near many and varied fantastic restaurants. It was nice to have free Wi-Fi, which we used quite a bit. The staff were helpful and friendly, and were very amenable to answering any questions we had and very accommodating re: calling for taxis we needed to get to the airport and train station. We both thought this was a great facility, and if I have the opportunity to visit Madrid again, I would definitely book a room at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super-friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in late May, 2011 and really enjoyed the entire experience. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and spacious (for Europe), and we had good service. The breakfast buffet was also excellent (it was not included in the price). The best thing was the location-we were right in the heart of Madrid and were able to go everywhere, such as good restaurants and museums, quickly and easily

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: manielita
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 nights at the Las Cortes Catalonia. It's the greatest hotel I have ever seen. The room was spacious, luxuous. The location is perfect, just in the center of Madrid and near of all the attractions. The staff is very kind, warm-hearted and helpful. I recomand this hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room and bath...walk in shower in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: yesiwearshoes
Reviews.Content: Excellent deal for a large European city. 5-10 minute walk from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: yconeh
Reviews.Content: We took the Las Cortes because of good reviews. We stayed April 16 - 24 2011. Total 8 nights. It was perfect. The best loction in the heart of the city, so, You can walk everywere. A 5-15 minutes walk to every Plaza (Sol, Mayor, Oriente, Cibeles...) to Prado museum, Retiro park or Palacio Real. The hotel staff were very friendly. We requested a Taxi or any information and got it immediately with a smile. We got a buffet breakfast and it was very very good. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with a huge shower and bath. there is free High Speed Internet everywere. All in all it was a great and we we certainly go back there or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, friendly staff, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gapesp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes with my wife last June (2010) during a 2 week trip through Spain. I was so smitten by this hotel, that nearly a year later, I have been reminded to leave a review. Madrid was our first stop in Spain and the hotel was a very pleasant welcome. I had done a lot of research and I was not disappointed. Our room was very nicely appointed, large, and extremely clean, with a cute balcony that looked out onto the street. The bathrooms were also very nice -- there were two separate shower stalls in our room! The hotel staff were quite patient, and even directed my wife and I to a great after hours lounge at about 1 am. Finally, you can't beat the location. You can walk virtually anywhere from this hotel which is blocks from museums, nightlife, great tapas, and shopping. We booked through european destinations, and though I was a bit wary of these type travel sites before, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Michael01UK
Reviews.Content: Pros: centrally located, on a very quiet street, very clean with outstanding bathrooms, which must have recently been renovated. We asked for a quiet room with two twin beds and we got what we asked for. Cons: beds were the hardest I have ever slept on (agree with last reviewer), the leg of my son's bed was broken, my blackberry ran out of power and they did not have a charger or even an adapter (my fault admittedly, but if a hotel says they cater to business travellers, this should be a given), service at the reception was good but they were massively understaffed and it took 5 minutes of waiting in line. OK but that is not 4 star service. Breakfasts were average. I would recommend this hotel as a good, upper end budget accommodation, but to say this is a 4 star hotel is inconsistent with other 4 star hotels I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good--but”
Reviews.Author: traveler1062
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good in several key aspects. it's convenient, well located, nicely furnished, and well decorated. The big CON however, is what have to be the world's hardest beds (even harder than the appropriately named Thistle Marble Arch). Unless you like to sleep in the morgue or need to straighten out a curvature of the spine, you won't get any sleep. We had a standard room that was pretty small The other reviewers must have had (or paid for) something we didn't get. Hotel service was very good and the staff (though quite small) very accomodating. If we could have gotten a good night's rest this would have been a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Petertheswiss
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Catalonia las Cortes is a charming and top class 4 star hotel in Madrid, just a few meters away from Plaza Santa Anna and in walking distance to the Museums and the historic Center. The Hotel is a great place to stay. We liked the large , beautifully furnished rooms and beds and enjoyed the great courtesy and hospitality of all their staff. They were extremely helpful to find and reserve top entertainment and dining places for us. For sure, when we return to Madrid, this is the place we stay !

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alanhLondon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel central and close to cafes/restaurants/tapas in a charming area, next to Santa Ana square. 5 mins walk to Metro and 10 mins to Prado/Reina Sofia museums. Staff very friendly and building is elegant with grand stairway and quiet spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcd1120
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Catalonia Las Cortes this month. I stayed with my two adult daughters in a superior triple room, and it was pretty much perfect. The room was clean, quiet, and elegantly furnished. The bathroom was beautiful, equipped with both a tub with shower as well as a huge walk-in shower. The staff at the front desk were friendly, helpful, and professional. The location was ideal - near Plaza Santa Ana and a number of good restaurants, and it was just a short walk to the Museum Triangle. The hotel breakfast was too expensive, so we went to the DOCC cafe which was just down the street from the hotel - go out the front door and turn right. The only very slight negative was that using the computer in the lobby requires one Euro coins for a short period of time. At this point most hotels offer free internet, so that was a tad annoying. Nevertheless, this was a great hotel and I would definitely want to stay there again on future trips to Madrid! For a great dinner try Ginger Restaurant on Plaza Santa Ana. Really delicious and very reasonably priced!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to have a great time at Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Oporto23
Reviews.Content: I must definitely say that is one of the best hotels I have stayed. The rooms are enormous, as well as the bathrooms. The service was also really helpful and the breakfast is delicious, people staying there should consider having breakfast at the hotel (good quality and value). Additionally the hotel is well-located and you can walk down to Plaza Sol area, Cibeles, Museums, Serrano, Gran Via, etc.....within a few minutes. This hotel should be the first choice for everyone who wants to stay centrically in Madrid at an excellent price, you will not find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room, unfortunately llittle noisy”
Reviews.Author: RogerdB
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel with a great location. The rooms are large and comfortable. Unfortunately I stayed there on a friday night and didn't get much sleep because of the noise of the people outside (even with double windows). So I would avoid the lower rooms with a street view if you want to get some sleep in the weekend. Besides that it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: lrf83
Reviews.Content: Had two beautiful, extremely well appointed rooms. Very quiet, even on New year's eve. The rooms felt like a much more expensive, 5 star hotel quality. They were very large, especially by European standards, and modern with large bathrooms with separate (huge) shower and tub. The hotel is located in a great, quiet area, easy walking distance to everything. The staff was extremely helpful, especially with clearing up a problem with our reservation before we arrived. Would highly recommend the Catalonia Las Cortes.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: christineBearsden Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel within easy walking distance to all the sights. Standard room was compact but beautifully appointed.Staff at reception and at breakfast very curtious and helpful.peaceful nights sleep with no noise from either inside or outside the hotel - loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business or fun”
Reviews.Author: drsh99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Catalonia las Cortes twice in the fall of 2010, both times for business. It is very conveniently located just off the Plaza Santa Ana, which means its easy to find food and entertainment right outside the hotel. The rooms are quiet, the hotel is very nicely appointed and the reception staff range from straightforward and competent to downright friendly and helpful. The off-season price was very reasonable. I also rented a meeting room, which was reasonably priced and came with coffee service, a nice bonus. The room itself was dimly lit, which was not the best environment for meeting, but it was spacious and pretty. The bedrooms are large for European standards, and the bathroom was huge in one room, and large in the other room. Breakfast is expensive, but convenient. Drawbacks for business traveler: no business center, although reception happily printed materials for us, and the tiny bar is really a pass-through from the reception to the elevator, so you can't have a private conversation/meeting in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: spunkymoose
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Las Cortes is located just off the Plaza Santa Ana. It is a short walk to the Prado and other major museums. Plaza Mayor is a short walk the other way and all major attractions are easy to get to. Plaza Santa Ana and the surrounding streets offer many good places to eat. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. Front desk is very helpful. Breakfast is quite good but pricey at 16 Euro. Various places close by offer less expensive, but less complete, alternatives. All in all, very nice stay, good facilities, good location, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: basilfriend
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a top floor (attic-ish) room with my wife and 11-year old - plenty of room, nice bathroom. Pretty straightforward hotel, nothing fancy but elegant, spotless and friendly. Best is the location - on Echegary/Prado, a block from Pza Santa Ana - in the middle of the bustle and nightlife of Madrid. In the morning don't think about breakfast in the hotel (which is extra) - enjoy the calm and huge range of bars for coffee and a pastry...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Happytravels74
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Las Cortes is in a fabulous location which is easy to get to, centrally located to key attractions in Madrid, surrounded by great plazas, bars and restaurants and set down a side street so a peaceful night's sleep is easy. Our room was spacious with a huge, remarkably comfortable bed. We were traveling on our honeymoon and initially found the reception staff to be a little offhand and aloof however Alia assisted us on our checkout and was lovely. Alia congratulated us on our wedding, gave us excellent guidance on the best way to get to the airport (the new bus service) and even went to the trouble of writing out some great tips on sights, bars and restaurants for Barcelona, our next destination. One very small negative is that we had a problem with the wifi in our room and ended up having to pay to use the internet on the PC in the lobby area. The cost of this was quite exorbitant and on the rest of our travels across Spain all hotels provided free PCs / laptops in the lobby for guests to use so perhaps this could be considered as an option here too. Overall we had a very good stay at Catalonia Las Cortes and would happily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet room, wifi.. But a stiff bed”
Reviews.Author: Mahtew
Reviews.Content: Here on honeymoon and pleasantly surprised by the beautifully layout room. Wifi signal is strong and this is a sure plus to us who are addicted to the net and sucker of skype. However, we got a king bed which is made up by 2 large single . To make matters worse, the beds are stiff... Overall, excellent hotel except for the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocation within walking distance to major sights”
Reviews.Author: Pavlich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, an easy walk to many of Madrid's landmarks, and a number of eating places. The front reception staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. The room was clean and pretty large with high ceilings and well appointed bathroom, and the very reasonable room rate included free WiFi. The negatives were the fact the bar fridge was not functioning (and went unattended despite raising it on arrival) and the noisy marble corridor, where anyone walking outside would be easily heard inside the room. But generally a pretty good hotel in a great location at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: oceanblue11731
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May of 2009. Great Location. Easy walk to the major site. Walking distance to the train station, and took a train / bus to Toledo. Toledo was an excellent excursion. Hotel staff was young and helpful. Breakfeast was included with our reservation, and the buffet was pretty good. A good way to start the morning. The rooms were very comfortable, and the shower was excellent. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Madrid is a nice walking city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very very good : nice rooms, amazing location, great value”
Reviews.Author: DAMR
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Las Cortes is a highly recommendable hotel. It is located a few meters away from the Plaza Santa Ana, which is the place where you want to be if you stay in Madrid : lively, tons of nice places where to eat tapas or have a drink, close to the museums and to nice barrios. The hotel in itself is very nice : wooden floor, nice funitures, very very clean. The rooms are in a remarkable state. Try to get one with a walk-in shower. Despite being in a lively area with pedestrian streets, it is very quiet as there are double windows in every room. Value is excellent, a mere 120 € with breakfast in November. Internet is complimentary. If I go back to Madrid, whether for business or for vacations, I will definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: SL0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the famous Plaza Santa Ana. In the barrio Huertas, which is a very madrileño area with not too many tourists (although Plaza Santa Ana is an exception) The staff is very nice and helpful and the rooms (especially the suites) are amazing! There are loads of good restaurants near the hotel and every importants sight is on walking distance. This is by far the best hotel in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Refined, elegant and luxurious, great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick255100
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip to Madrid and we found the Catalonia Las Cortes to be perfectly located near the Santa Ana Plaza, with walkable distances to all the main attractions. It had a boutique feel (small, intimate), with an elegant touch. The room was spacious, as was the beautifully fitted marble bathroom - plush towels, toiletries, gift packs, and the biggest bed we had ever seen! On our return from dinner, our beds had been turned down and chocolates left. Breakfast was not included but available for 16euros, which we thought a bit much when a fresh warm croissant and an espresso could be bought round the corner for a few euros. On the whole, however, we would highly recommend this hotel. It was cheaper than the funky place up the road that we stayed at at the start of our trip, and was much more hospitable and comfortable. A lovely stay. R and A Patrick Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very fancy”
Reviews.Author: TouristNerd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights only unfortunately. The rooms are really spacious and extremely clean. The location is within walking distance of all of the attrations that we didnt need to catch public transport at all, the furtherest attractions is probably about a 15-20 minute walk. Nearly all the staff speak english and if they dont there is always someone close by that speaks english which helpes alot. Room service is also excellent which we ordered the first night and it wasn't too pricey for this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a trip at the Catalonia Las Cortes for our two year anniversary. Here are our comments: -The location of this hotel is great. It is less than a minute walk to the Plaza Santa Ana, about 10 minutes walk to the Prado, and about 10 minutes walk to Puerta del Sol. -I recommend taking the metro here from the airport. Despite having to take two transfers to get here, it is the most efficient, economic way. It costs two euros, and if you are an avid traveler like my husband and I are, and know how to not overpack, carrying your suitcases up the metro stairs is not a big deal. Take the Anton Martin stop and walk up Calle de Leon (which is right off the metro stop) two minutes. Turn left on Calle de Huertas, and an immediate right on to Calle Echegaray. Once you hit the first street, Calle del Prado, you are there! -We stayed in room 108. It was lovely and clean, but being on the first floor, there was a lack of privacy. Also, the bed was quite hard, which was unfortunate. There is also no clock in the room, so either bring one or have your cell phone handy. The windows in the room also don't open. The shower in the room was amazing! -The front desk staff knows adequate English to help you get around and make reservations for events and dinner. We would stay here again...we liked the hotel a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Good But Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: afcok
Reviews.Content: First the positives. The hotel is good value for money. It has an excellent and quiet location with all the sites of the city within walking distance. It is well mainatined with pleasant decor. We had a comfortable bedroom and a clean, spacious bathroom. However, our 5th floor room was small with no space at all for luggage storage. It had just one small window. The front desk staff only spoke when spoken to, not a single greeting on exit or entry during a 5 day stay. The breakfast cost is 3 or 4 times as expensive as that available in local cafes. Internet access in the bar area costs 2 Euros for 10 minutes which is simply robbery, local internet cafes charge 2 Euros an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but skip the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Catalonia Las Cortes and it was a good central base from which to explore the city. It was a 10-15 minute walk from Atocha train station, and a similar walk to Plaza Mayor. Our room was large, with a beautiful spacious bathroom (oddly lacking amenities, no shampoo or lotion). The bed, however, was the least comfortable of anyplace we stayed in Spain. We had no problems with noise, and everything was clean and well-kept. The lobby was small and not very inviting. Also, the PC in the lobby required payment to use, so no free access to check the weather or anything - one thing I would look for if I were to return to Madrid. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel (Starbucks just down the road on Paseo del Prado got us going most days) but did make the mistake of eating in the hotel restaurant one evening when we came back from an all-day trip too exhausted to go out. It was absolutely dreadful - bright lights, cafeteria ambience, bad food. We should have walked a half block up the street and picked any of the half-dozen restaurants on P. Santa Ana!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler1255
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel at 11:30 in morning after a 14 hour flight. Staff was very accomodating by checking us in early.
