The location is excellent, room very nice but could use a better AC system. We were on fifth floor and it could barely keep up and it was only 83 degrees outside. Room was a bit sparse on basic toiletries, especially a 4-star should have lotion and housekeeping took shampoo after first night and we had to go down to front desk and ask for more. Staff was sometimes very aloof not even looking up from front desk as we arrived or left and other times quite friendly. The hotel is situated close to Plaza Santa Ana which has a great nightlife. Overall a great stay in a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: hip66po
Reviews.Content: Simple, clean, quiet - All you need for a business night, well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Great location, with restos, tapa bars, etc. on your doorstep. Great breakfast buffet. Staff very helpful for all inquiries and requests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kreynor
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel so much that we booked it for both legs of our trip in and out of Madrid. The interior of the hotel is simply gorgeous. There are lots of little lounges throughout the hotel the were nice places to sit and read. The rooms were large, quiet, and very elegant. Both rooms we had were clean with good AC. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Hotel uses RFID keys so no need to be leaving at the desk every time you go out. Hotel is just a short walk to the Prado and the Atocha train station. There is internet, but it was occasionally troublesome. Sometimes it would work in the room only, other times only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel, well located.”
Reviews.Author: cmorrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights before driving off to Granada. The hotel is well located for the Plaza Mayor and Retiro Park and Prado. Being in an inner-city block there is not much to view, and our 2 small windows on the top (5th) floor allowed squints onto the roof-scape. This was the only downside on 2 otherwise spacious and comfortable rooms (one with sofa-bed to make a triple, one a double they let us have as a single) and we had no complaints on the comfort. No noisy neighbours, even though we shared a wall with my daughter who had the TV on, so insulation must be good - and no bath gurgles. Staff were largely very friendly. The lady getting us in and out was courtesy and welcome herself. The young main asked to help find the car rental place already knew where it was (FYI after the luggage check inside Atocha station departures - look very carefully for the signs, which are more visible going W-E across the concourse) and was able to reassure from his own problems finding it. The restaurant was closed when we arrived but the bar staff and a guy dealing with the kitchen were happy to run us up omelette and crisps - at room service rates, but very helpful. Good breakfast buffet. Minor gripes - the wi-fi did not work on the 5th floor. They got the IT guy to reset the router, but when it still didn't work, said "but he's reset the router!" rather than think it might need another kick. But it worked fine in the bar. The lady who gave us a city map was off-hand - but that was it. To avoid late-night room service charges, it's worth looking at the Pl. Sa. Ana up the hill - we wished we'd seen the O Chaco galician restaurant first, and the kids' playground outside included a conjuror! For basics, the chinese-run supermarket on c/de Leon, down the hill did the cheapest mineral water we found on our trip, and would do other stuff. We did eat at the Cuban place across from the hotel, ok, good mojitos, but at EUR120 for 3+child, dear. Lastly, beware getting acosted by young girls in Retiro park - mid-morning this was - it looks as if they want you to sign a petition, and then they hit you for a EUR20 charity contribution, and you may already have given them your address on the petition. Nothing happened, but just in case.... Enjoy. Do walk down the stairs and see the stained glass on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AroundtheWorld24
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Las Cortes was a great place to stay. The staff were efficient and friendly, with no issues checking in or out. We had a room on the fourth floor. The room was quite large with a king sized bed, or at least equivalent. The bed was a bit firm, but not unbearable. The room had a mini refrigerator which was great for storing drinks as it was quite hot during our stay in Madrid. The air conditioning in the room worked perfectly. The bathroom was tremendous with a gigantic shower stall, and also a bathtub with shower. So more than one person could shower at the same time in this large bathroom! The room was very clean also. You could hear noise if a person were walking by in the hallway due to tile/wooden flooring, but never at any time were there problems with noise. We did not use the restaurant, but the hotel was in decent walking distance to the main attractions and other restaurants. I would definitely stay here again! Tip: The Cuban restaurant that is located across the street diagonally from the hotel is very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large rooms, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kidfree
Reviews.Content: Madrid was our first stop on a 4 city trip thru Spain. I will admit that our impression of Madrid was a bit marred by the fact hat my luggage was misplaced and did not arrive until 2 days later. However, this hotel was lovely. While the rooms are not fancy or plush they are well appointed. The bathroom was large and the shower was very good. The AC worked perfectly and the bed was comfortable. Our rate include breakfast which was very nice with lots of choices and very attentive coffee service. The location is great - Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, The Prado were all within a 10 or 15 minute walk. There are lots of nice tapas bars right on the Plaza. While there is alot going on in the Plaza the hotel was nice and quiet and we slept great. This is really a very good option in terms of rooms, ovation and service. But if you are looking for trendy or plush, this is not for you

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, charming, and well-located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Skylarks
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on a Saturday night and were told that it was fully booked. The staff were very apologetic and said that the hotel would pay for a taxi to take us to one of their sister hotels (Catalonia Gaudi). We decided to move back to the Catalonia Las Cortes after one night. Although the staff were very helpful, the moves wasted a lot of time on what was only a long weekend stay, and we had to pay for our own taxi when we returned after one night at the other hotel. The staff at the Catalonia Las Cortes were very nice, and all spoke very good English. They were helpful with advice on how to get to places, and kept the breakfast going a little while longer if we came down late. The restaurant was bright and clean, and the selection of food at breakfast was amazing. The hotel itself was very charming and well-decorated, with spacious seating areas outside the bedrooms and a grand staircase. The room was very big, and the bathroom had a separate bath and shower. The hotel is a minute’s walk from a square which was bustling with people sitting outside eating in the evenings. There was a supermarket very nearby which was convenient, and the metro station was a 5-7 minute walk away. The hotel itself was on a quiet street, and although there was some construction work going on outside, this did not bother us (there was no noise from it). It is quite a trek on the metro from the airport to this hotel (you have to change lines twice and there are lots of stairs to manoeuvre if you have suitcases), and a taxi is expensive (at least 30 euros). I would recommend this hotel for comfort, elegant décor, friendliness and location. I found it a bit pricey, but you may be able to get a better deal if you book early.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Amaklo
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel and we got a good rate of 130 euros for a single (which had a king size bed) and 149 euros for a twin (two single beds). Breakfast was not included and is rather pricey at 16 euros, so we went elsewhere. The rooms were very large and comfortable. The bathrooms are big and well stocked with toiletries. My only complaint is their odd lighting/air conditioning system which requires a room card to work so the rooms were very warm when we first entered (it was 90 degrees in Madrid while we were there). As previous posters have noted, it is a very short walk to a plaza with many outdoor tables for restaurants that ring the plaza. We can second the recommendation for the restaurant Lateral, which has wonderful tapas. The construction work has moved down the street so noise is not an issue. The hotel is well located within walking distance to the museums in one direction and the royal palace in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from Atocha Train Station”
Reviews.Author: Italy72381
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that was walking distance from the Atocha train station. The hotel rooms are adorable and nicely furnished. Our double bed was HUGE and very comfortable. The hotel staff were helpful and spoke English. There is a nearby plaza with a restaurant by the name of Lateral. We highly recommend it. We ate 6 or 7 tapas and had beer and sangria and our bill came out to under 40 euros. The food was excellant. There is construction going on right in front of the hotel which kept the street closed to traffic. This was great so at night there was no noise from outside. Even with the nearby plaza and all the outside restaurants we were able to sleep without a problem. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel and found nearby places to have coffee and toast. Overall the location was good. We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see. Very close to the museum and botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot, quiet rooms, friendly hosts”
Reviews.Author: nombre_10
Reviews.Content: We had an great time in this beautiful hotel with very friendly hosts, in an ideal spot close to both the old center (with tapas bars and jazz cafes) and the Prado and Thijssen-B musea. The service was excellent, the room was spacious and clean, the buffet breakfast delicious..

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Barjohn_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a great position close to Plaza Santa Ana and within walking distance of art galleries and museums, parks, shops, restaurants, Plaza Mayor and major sites. We had a spacious, spotlessly clean, nicely decorated, quiet room with lage bathroom. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast with its wide selection of hot and cold food which set us up for the day. Friendly helpful and efficient staff made for a very enjoyable stay at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkfromCA
Reviews.Content: Was my first time in Madrid. Hotel was small and luxury. The room was as expected for Europe small, but the details in the hotel were charming. Service was good, room and hotel was clean. Hotel was 1/2 block from a great square with lots of dinning and bars. There was also a nice hotel on the square with an amazing rooftop bar. Only negative is the small street/road in front of the hotel is being worked on so my taxi was not able to drop me off right in front. I had to walk about 1/2 block. I would stay there again as the price was good and again the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: terryandhelen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position and was much better than I expected. The room was quite spacious and very clean. We requested a room in a quiet location and were given one facing the courtyard - fantastic. Breakfast was a little dear -16 euro pp -so we walked to Plaza de Santa Ana, 100m down the street, where there were plenty of cafes with well priced menus. Prado museum and other sites were within walking distance. The hotel was a great base from which to explore Central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tricky129
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a couple of days. Hotel doesn't seem like much on the outside but it has an excellent location in the heart of Madrid. The lobby area is kind of small but clean and well kept. Staff was ok with english and the service at front desk was ok. My room was spacious with the standard european hard double mattresses pushed together. Room was spotless and the bathroom was huge with a modern bath and shower with double sinks. Only drawback was the tiny television and spotty wireless access. I was there for business and it suited me fine but not sure price wise how it compares to other hotels in Madrid. One disappointment was that they do not have iron and ironing boards available - not all that great when you are living out of your suitcase and need to get your clothes up to snuff before a meeting!.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: chrisp1946
Reviews.Content: Stayed fro 3 nights on short holiday break . Paid reasonable price for a 4 star hotel but surprised by some of the reviews which have suggested this is a fantastic hotel . First the plus points , great position , comfortable room , really good shower and good choice at breakfast . Service was fine , helpful and reasonably friendly but no more than one would expect from this class of hotel . Now the down sides , the hotel has a feel of a standard fairly corporate hotel \The décor is slightly formal and the toiletries are of a distinctively 3 star standard . The bed was very hard and not comfortable . However it is a sprung mattress and we slept ok despite this . One very jarring note is the charge for using the computer in the bar. At 2 Euros for 10 minutes . During the whole time we were there we saw no one use the machine . A really good hotel would have given free access to residents . Despite these quibbles this is a good hotel in a great position and i would highly recommend it to anyone going to Madrid for a holiday . With a few adjustments it could be better

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't praise more”
Reviews.Author: reginag59
Reviews.Content: We'll add our praise to the others on the site. We stayed for five nights in April 2010 on our first trip to Madrid. Location was perfect for walking to major sites, staff friendly and helpful to non-Spanish speakers, room small but very comfortable. Free Wi-Fi!! Great bathroom and shower. Plaza de Santa Ana nearby had wonderful food, drinks and people-watching. Save some money and just go to the rooftop bar of the nearby ME boutique hotel for a drink to enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel for everything.”
Reviews.Author: whitworthd9
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, wonderful location, fabulous breakfast,walking distance most sights, near metro.Friendly staff. Big rooms & quite at night-time. I would highly recommend this hotel and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLittletonCO
Reviews.Content: Immaculate, gracious bilingual staff, very helpful, presently has construction in front but soon to end, rm 308 had an enormous granite/marble? walk in shower, terrific breakfasts, location is excellent, 15 walk to the Prado, 1 block to a large busy plaza. Tapas bar next door. Might want to request room in back to avoid late night noise when restaurants close. Would have liked a more comfortable chair in our room, basically a desk chair, bed was excellent. A lot of open space available for seating if you do not want to stay in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The location of the hotel is perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Maz6721
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. Right next to the bars and restaurants of plaza Santa ana and within easy walking distance of la Latina neighbourhood, plaza mayor, puerta de la sol and the excellent big 3 museums. Having arrived late at 1.30 am, we were checked in quickly and efficiently. Room was spacious and absolutely spotless. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: need2travel_99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Madrid for few days after traveling around some of the surrounding area and the Hotel Catalonia exceeded our expectations. It is a very nice hotel, clean rooms and very spacious for typical European hotel rooms. The staff was helpful with recommendations for dining and entertainment. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. One caution, parking is expensive if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: HKCunli
Reviews.Content: I was not really looking forward to seeing Madrid - just another big city, I thought. I was also very conflicted about where to stay, too many choices, and they would probably all be just typical big city hotels. Well, I was wrong about both Madrid and the Hotel Catalonia las Cortes. I would DEFINITELY return to Madrid, and if I do, we will stay here again. Despite road work that was going on directly in front of the hotel, and the fact that our room was over the sliding door (could hear the sounds of it opening), we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, and found it to be very quiet - something I always worry about with city hotels. Our room was HUGE, an entryway, two beds pushed together (as is usual) to make the biggest bed we had ever stayed in - I somehow think they were larger than 2 twins as one night we even ended up staying on the same side of the bed all night! Great bathroom with good shower (another thing we like!), and we felt the location was truly perfect. I realize that we really only saw a small part of Madrid, because we never took any transportation, just walked - but we were close enough to the Museums that we were able to pop over when the Prado was free and wander for a short time, returning 2 more times during the weekend - this is a great way to see an art musuem in my opinion. There were good restaurants all around (but we didn't have a bad meal during our whole Spain trip), and the staff was so friendly, allowing me to practice my Spanish, giving good restaurant recs. We used the free wi-fi too and did I mention the breakfast? Okay, initially I thought 16 euros each for Breakfast? We'll go out. But we gave it a try the first day and there was no way we weren't coming back the next 2 days. It was WELL worth the money - everything you could want, lots of coffee, friendly service. By far our best breakfast of our trip. Though there are many choices in Madrid, we enjoyed ourselves so much here that I would have no problem returning here, leaving all the research and "will I like this" question for another city!

Reviews.Title: “would not hesitate to recommend”
Reviews.Author: acribari
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here last month and loved it. We did not arrive until midnight and received a cheery, warm welcome. Everyone we encounters at the property offer friendly, excellent service. Best location, super clean and comfortable. I must say we did not think the breakfast was so spectacular like many other viewers but it was just fine. We would stay again and it was a fantastic value. If you need it, WIFI was spotty and available in the reception area only.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to reproach”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie_and_Nikolas
Reviews.Content: The hotel boasts a fantastic location - close to everything and yet very quiet. We appreciated it a lot. The interior of the hotel demonstrates a good taste of the owners and a sence of style. Do not miss a pleasure to use the stairs instead of an elevator - I promise it will be worth your efforts. The rooms are very elegant and show the same "empire-like" style I like so much. And the bathrom was just enormous - with a separate walk-in shower and a bathtub. The cleanliness is just spotless. The breakfast offered is one of the best we've ever seen in different hotels - both the variety of food and its quality. And yes, the croissants are really fantastic. The waiters were very attentive and friendly as were the staff at the reception. We really liked the hotel and will definitely recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lively nightlife and close to major art galleries”
Reviews.Author: CheshirePegs
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome given by the staff at this lovely hotel was in perfect counterpoint to the chilliness of the weather outside, after all it was February! Rooms are both stylish and comfortable with all the amenities one would expect in a 4 star hotel. The only downside was that the air conditioning was a little loud, however we did have this turned on to full during the night. The location is perfect for visiting the museums and art galleries and it was apparent that the area will become lively and buzzing come the onset of Spring. Even in snowy February it has a good vibe. The area feels very 'local' and a wander down the side streets will reveal wonderful shops: small grocery shops selling artisan hams and cheeses, fish shops, fruit and vegetables, and small shops catering to the needs of 'real' people. One word of warning; it is very easy to overeat in the local bars and restaurants as the tapas portions are enormous. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dhviola
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. It is perfectly located just 2 minutes' walk from the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and just a few minutes further to the Prado. My room was spacious for a single by European standards and was immaculately clean. It was very quiet, though if it had been crowded that might have changed, since I could clearly hear other guests in the hallway. The staff was very helpful, and I loved the neighborhood. I got a great deal online through the hotel's website. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AJSOT
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Madrid and would definately recommend this hotel. The location was perfect, rooms were spacious and very clean. The hotel was generally quiet due to the time of the year but we were not disturbed in any way. In fact we slept so well we nearly missed breakfast. The breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice. The staff spoke good English and were very friendly and helpful. We hope to return to Madrid and would not hesitate in booking a room at the Catalonia Las Cortes.

Reviews.Title: “Well located -- unacceptable breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: Hiendri
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central location in walking distance to the most important sites. Rooms are nice. However, the service of the restaurant is unsatisfactory, i.e. staff serving breakfast is ignorant. They refused to serve us cappucino/cortado and gave us café americano instead. However, a few minutes later, the staff served cappucino to other guests asking for it. When complaining at the rececption we were told that we should get a cappucino when asking for it. We tried the next day and asked politely. Again, the staff denied our request but served cappucino to other guests. The reception staff only told us that they couldn't do anything and that we should talk again to the person in charge. On the third day, another serving crew first wanted to charge us the cappucino separately. Finally we got our coffee within the price of the breakfast, i.e. 16 Euros. This service is just unacceptable and does not meet the standard one could expect of a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, excellent service and plenty of space!!”
Reviews.Author: xfilemed
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and some friends in this hotel for a weekend in Madrid. The location could not have been better: right next to the bustling Plaza Santa Ana, a few minutes walk to Puerta del Sol, Museo del Prado, Parque del Retiro, etc. The neighbourhood the hotel belongs to is refered to as "Barrio de las Letras" ("Literature District") and is absolutely charming. The staff at the hotel (reception, breakfast room and concierge) was very polite and professional, always willing to go the extra mile to help out. We stayed in a huge room, one of the largest I have ever been too (and I have been to many US hotels!!), with a huge king-size bed, plenty of light and a large bathroom too. The hotel has a classic deco, but it has been totally reformed so it is spotless everywhere. I will definitely be back again on my next short visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location”
Reviews.Author: RosaTiritilli
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the main tourist spots in Madrid. I came to the hotel directly from Barajas airport and went down the subway Puerta del Sol, which is best if you are traveling with luggage. If the backpack is a metro that is near (Anton Martin): it is just 3 blocks from the hotel. We rented a car and than the location is not so good. The public parking for 10 hours costs 28EUR, the most expensive of all of Spain in the Plaza de Santa Ana. The hotel room was not the greatest, but nicely decorated and clean. It was very worthwhile. I would be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_traveladdicts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. Hotel rooms is lovely, comfortable and clean. Bathroom is OK, but not relative to the room price. Hotel staff were very nice and helpful. Location is brilliant but no free parking and parking in Madrid is VERY expensive. There are a multitude of restaurants just up in the square near the hotel and they are all quite good, with varying prices. We would probably stay here again based on the location, but we thought it was a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Apalling customer care”
Reviews.Author: Generaal
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to a great stay as this hotel as it looks stunning, but unfortunately looks can be deceiving. After booking the hotel, confirming the reservation on the arrival day and again a few hours before arrival, the hotel staff still managed to book us into the wrong type of room. There was no apology for or alternative to the single room available even though a twin had been booked and confirmed. After 2 hours of trying to get any help or assistance from the hotel staff and manager, we eventually reverted to using bookings.com to arrange an alternative hotel but it still cost at least 3 hours of hassle & delay late at night to sort out. My advice would be to be wary of expecting a confirmed booking to be honoured by this hotel, but as I said before it is a lovely looking place.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, well situated, clean and great service”
Reviews.Author: francelonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early October 2009. The hotel is very well located - only 2-3 minutes from Anton Martin metro and very close to Plaza Mayor. Despite being in the thick of it, our room was very quiet. Washrooms are very nicely sized - rainforest showerhead was a nice touch. My wife complained that there were no bathroom products in the room, though, and that the hairdryer was ineffective. My only complaint is that the WiFi was very temperamental. Our first room had no reception so we asked to be moved. The second room had good reception but the hotel system kept dropping the connection. Hotel staff tried to fix the problem was it was understandably beyond them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good value, friendly staff, well located, enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: hardenedtraveler
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 days at Hotel Las Cortes, booked after reading good reviews at Tripadvisor. It exceeded our expectations with good sized bathroom/shower and reasonable bedroom space. Staff very helpful. Well located for tourists. Did not dine there but buffet breakfasts were better than most tourist hotels and whole hotel very clean with good aircon and wifi. We would go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Cortesia Madrilena at its best”
Reviews.Author: gabrielsmom
Reviews.Content: Strategically situated at a beautiful walking distance from El Prado at one end and Plaza Major at the other, Catalonia Las Cortes, delivers Madrid warmth and charm in every sense of the word. Any one of the service members, at any time of the day or any shift, in a city that truly doesn't sleep, will gladly assist you with charismatic warmth and professionalism that is not only charming, but leaves you yearning for a longer visit! The hotel excels in cleanliness and delivers Madrid to your room in every one of their special touches, including the fragrance in the air. Definitely a centric place in old Madrid without the hype (and price tag) of chain hotels. I'm still in awe with the elegant simplicity and warmth of the place! Kudos to its staff and management!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SkipAhoy
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels in Europe which are in right in the city centre, you will pay a higher price for a 4* or 5* central hotel. I have been fortunate enough to have stayed in my fair share of 5* hotels and resorts around the world...mainly with work and so when it comes to my own travel I do get quite fussy. Quality and standard: This hotel looks as though it has been refurbished sinced many of the comments made in 2007. The pictures on the web are very accurate. We had a double room and (without asking) got a king size bed...lovely). (€105/night w/o breakfast). This price compared very favourably with other hotels of the same calibre. Cleanliness: Very. Decor: Exccellent condition...it looks like it was refurbished in the past 1-2 years Food: we did not eat in so I have not comments. For breakfast, we went to the cafe on the corner of Plaza Santa Ana serves all you can eat breakfast for €12 pp....it is next to Room Mate Alicia and indeed Room Mate Alicia hotel also uses this cafe for their breakfasts!! The receptionsists were welcomiong and friendly. The concierge was friendly, although he did not speak any English...what do expect...he isn't American! When the aircon wasn't working he knew exactly what to do and 10min later we were cool. The hotel is 1min from Plaza Santa Ana. Noise was not a problem....and the locals will party to late in the night around here. The rooms had double windows...better than double glazing and this stopped 99.9% of any noise. Inter room noise was also nil, although I did hear a flushing toilet at one point late at night. Room Mate Alicia is on the corner of this square and a couple of guests had issues with stolen bags. Reading their reports I can only say that it was more likely that the guests need to be more on the look out for their own things. In any city (and I live in London), you have to keep an eye on your property and to keep it close. Our receptionist did warn us of possible pickpockets etc, .....was I concerned?, not overly. It's the same in Barcelona, Paris, New York, Brussels, Rome, Florence, London, Berlin.......tourists are a target anywhere. Location: Very good for all the sites and you can easily walk to Plaza Mayor in 10-15 min. Plaza Santa Ana is 1 min walk - greta for evening drinks and dinner. Prado is 15min. Palace is 20min. Sunday Market is 15min....all times approx but it you don't need taxis! Recommendation to others: Yes Stay again: Yes...unless I got a better deal else where :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: CatsCol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Catalonia Las Cortes for 3 nights in early June. The staff were extremely helpful and great for directions and ideas for things to do. We had a lovely corner room with 2 windows and large bathroom. The bed was really comfortable and there was loads of space for clothes, travel bags etc. There was no mini bar however. Location is perfect, just beside the Lovely Plaza Santa Ana where you can enjoy good food and drinks in the sunshine. We bought a 3 day metro pass at the airport but ended up not using it as the location was so good, we walked everywhere. If you like cool funky bars, pay a trip to The Penthouse bar in Plaza Santa Anna for great views over the city. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, affordable rooms in the middle of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: naranja23
Reviews.Content: We just loved this place, and opening the doors into our room was a wonderful moment. Lovely furnishings, a sea of quiet, and what felt like 3 large rooms (bathroom, foyer, bedroom) for the price of 1. This part of Madrid is very active, busy, and full of life just outside the door, but our room (facing interior courtyard) was a great oasis. Hotel staff was efficient if not overly enthusiastic, but with rooms and location like this, we would stay here 10 times out of 10 in the future. Convenient to all the major museums and many of the happening neighborhoods. Basically 15-25 minutes away from everything, and closer if you prefer the subway. A cab from the airport ran about 23 Euros, and from the P.A. train station about 6 Euros. Tip: There is a laundromat just around the corner of the hotel. That's a good way to save some money for an extra night at this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “It was so clean, friendly and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: JDGClifton_Texas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Madrid to see the Jaoquin Sorolla Exhibit at the El Prado Museum and it was minutes away and a pleasant walk, as well as the Plaza Mayor, Retiro Park and lots of great tapa restaurants. They have a nice restaurant but a little pricey. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful and they spoke english! The room was so nice and clean and cool! Just make sure you have two room keys as one of them keeps the air on! Nice remodeled bathrooms with great showers. We would certainly stay there again! Be careful, there are pickpockets. My husband caught one knuckles deep in front velcrow pocket. We resorted to the money belt and it worked great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for enjoying the sights of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: reedfamilyboa
Reviews.Content: Great location in central Madrid and within a few metres of the lively Plaza de St Ann and 10 minutes walking distance to the likes of Retiro Park (lovely gardens and boating lake), Prado Museum (classy renaissance art) and Peurto Del Sol (shopping and metro system hub). Hotel is decorated in an elegant manner and rooms are comfortable - although small. We didn't pay the extra 40 euros for a suite as our stay was only 3 nights. We didn't use the restaurant as there were some many bars and cafes near by. The hotel bar was quiet but comfortable. Reception staff were also very helpful - although their english was limited. Internet access is available but only via a pay as you go PC in the bar/reception area. I had a few problems printing out airline boarding passes on this PC but reception staff were helpful and allowed me to use their office PC to get the passes printed. All things considered the hotel was very good value for money and ideal for our short visit to Madrid. One word of warning - not about the hotel - but about eating out in the Plaza Mayor ... bottom line is don't. It is a rip-off. Good place to walk through due to the interesting buildings and the occasional street entertainer but definitely not a place to eat. Try one of the smaller plazas that litter Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant/romantic rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RoomRaider69
Reviews.Content: + Elegant and romantic rooms that made my Spanish girlfriend swoon. We had a quiet corner room with two Juliet balconies, hardwood floor, tray ceiling, fridge/mini-bar, free internet, and comfortable king bed. + Great location. I have been to Madrid many times; this hotel is in the middle of everything--the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor 10 min walk to the west, the Ritz, Prado, and Retiro 10 min walk to the east. And Plaza Santa Ana--great for drinks--a block away. It's a bit of a walk to the subway, but you won't really need it being this central. Downside: - The room reeked of mildew. The shower backsplash doesn't drain the water properly into the tub, so it's no wonder the mildew is uncontrollable. The amenities (soap, shampoo, towels) weren't what you'd expect at a 4* place. The lobby/front desk could be straight out of a hostel--cramped and cluttered. Fortunately the rooms make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jmwing
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. Our room was clean and spacious. The location is great--easy walk to Plaza del Sol, tons of restaurants, el Prado, el Palacio Real, el Retiro, etc. Front desk was helpful in assisting with directions. Free beer (!) in the lobby also. I would recommend Vinoteca for tapas, just down the street, on the Plaza Santa Ana.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: KlingonWarrior
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is off the major streets but extremely well situated regarding museums, shopping, and sightseeing. Everything (Palacio Real, the Prado, and Gran Via) is within walking distance and the metro is only a couple of blocks away. The hotel employees spoke good English for the most part and were very helpful with recommendations, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: niclak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we first visited Madrid and considering that we had got a fantastic deal with Expedia, we were pleasantly surprised by its high standards. Our room was very large, clean and just generally nice. The only reason why I'm not giving it full marks is because the air-con didn't seem to work properly / the room always seemed very 'stuffy'. Hotel staff very extremely attentive and friendly, especially the people at reception. The general appearance of the hotel was very good too and the location was perfect - an easy stroll to a superb ice-cream place and tourist sites. Plus Plaza Santa Ana is just up the road. What else could one wish for?!?!? :-)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tine27
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the catalonia las cortes for a week in may. very clean rooms, wonderful air conditioning, quiet and in a great location within walking distance to the museums (10 minute walk), royal palace (15-20 minute walk) and helpful staff. we stayed in a basic room and it was better than what i expected. if you're willing to pay more, you can get a bigger room with a small balcony. i would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms - a few minor problems.”
Reviews.Author: Portia08
Reviews.Content: Plan to stay in one of the gorgeous rooms with frescoed ceilings, and you won't be disappointed. We stayed in 203, a suite with two such ceilings. Room 202 - a superior that we saw - is if anything even lovelier although without the sitting room. What could be improved? First, soft towels - the ones provided are so over-laundered that they are stiff and scratchy. Second, reasonable prices for the minibar. After staying at many beautiful top-notch places throughout Spain and finding free or economically priced water for the thirsty traveler, I was surprised to pay 2,50 euros for a small bottle of water. Other items showed a similar large mark-up. We did not try the restaurant for breakfast, which may be it's strong suit, but our dinner there was the worst we had in Spain. Many items on the short menu were not available and the veal I ordered was served not with the listed - and desired - Normandy apple and onion sauce, but with some dried herbs sprinkled over a spectacularly greasy piece of undercooked meat. My husband's fish was not fresh and was inedible. Appetizers of gnocchi (overcooked and spongy) and the Caprese salad (acceptable tomatoes and mozzarella ruined by a topping of dry rather than fresh basil) also disappointed. The waitress was sweet and apologetic, but could not compensate for the disaster perpetrated by the chef.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: kek12345
Reviews.Content: Located in historic center of Madrid near the main museums, Palace, cathedrals, etc. Helped arrange reservations for an excellent Flamenco show within easy walking distance (Casa de Patas). Staff extremely helpful. Room was very nice, air conditioned, pedestrian street view. You might say a little noisy at night but that's because the Spanish eat late and the street doesn't quiet down until midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, breakfast, and more location”
Reviews.Author: annibalepreca
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Apart that the foyer is really very *** , low ceilings and decorated like a Hong Kong handbag and accessory shop, lots of white marble, somewhat tawdry light fittings and brass detailing. However the rooms are quite splendid - spacious, well-furnished, great bathrooms, comfortable beds. To people who trot out the time-worn adage that they "are only going to sleep in them", that is quite a lot of the twenty four hours , I wonder how much time they intend spending in the foyer or hotel bar? This is the antithesis of most hotels that offer luxurious public rooms and horrible, little, claustrophobic boxes masquerading as luxury bedrooms. The breakfast, served in an austere subterranean dining room -not a particularly pleasant place - is none-the-less superlative for quality. This is not a copious buffet of everything and anything but a well chosen selection of all the best appropriate produce in the local market. On an occasion when I was too late for the hotel breakfast I went to the Alicia Room Mate next door .The comparison was extreme, their breakfast in the tapas bar adjacent was very poor, and the place had the unpleasant aura of a highway pull-in on the morning after the night before. My wife was attending a dental convention, leaving me pushing the baby and I did not feel much drawn a huge "deluxe" convention hotel at least twenty minutes walk along broad and traffic jammed streets to get anywhere I might want to be. The hotel in question describes itself as being "at the strategic center of Madrid" ( I guess it all depends on whether you can throw a stone that far, etc. ) Several trip advisors warned that the hotel in question is partially surrounded by a seedy red-light district, 'though one American lady did admit that they were of a better class! Where the Catalonia Las Cortes really excels is on its location and I am not thinking only of major tourist attractions. Much, much more than that, the hotel is on the old town areas of Las Huertas and La Latina which remain firmly in a time warp. Touristic nonsense has not yet forced out the real shops that people need, as in the old centers of most European cities The Marais in Paris is case in point, the Jewish delicatessens and shoe repairers are no more, forced out by multiple branches of l"Occitane and dubious jewelery shops. Enjoy that whilst it stands, probably not for so long. The general fruit and vegetable market at Anton Martin (easy walking distance) is the perfect antidote to too much of being the sightseer. You can return to the human race having a coffee with the traders at the small bar upstairs. Just up the road from the hotel but far enough away to avoid the night time din is Pz Santa Ana which has a lot of quite reasonable tapas type bars that are friendly, relaxed and informal. Remember the Spaish start very late and throw all their rubbish on the floor ! You can so easily slip back to the hotel to rest before going out to take a glass of wine and a snack. That can easily occupy five or six hours. A bit further and you come to the famous and impressive Pz Mayor which is a commercialised hell-hole . Don't even think of eating there and the same goes for the horrible Puerta del Sol where a lot of younger people hang about to imbibe the traffic fumes. My lasting memory - the view from the balcony into an old barber's shop with brightly coloured bottles of bay rum, macassar, oil of violets,. and, tubs of brilliantine bearing the labels unchanged for near a century. Of course the obligatory rotating, stripey pole, red on white (or is it white on red?) drawing the eye in hypnotically. The barber quite as antiquated as his clientele, and most with little left except for a shave and polish. A morning of hand shaking and back patting before moving on, all bright as new pins, to read the papers in a favourite cafe. To have the same arguments and tell the same jokes. It could have been anywhere in Spain, but it was right under our balcony.What a great hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: mcadc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "superior" room so that may have influenced our impression of our stay (spacious room, large comfortable bed, small balcony overlooking street) but we found Las Cortes to be the perfect place to stay. Regardless, would highly recommend staying in the Barrio de las Letras neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Stay HERE, best place in MARDID”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Abscess
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? This is a great hotel, I did lots of research and it paid off, thank you TRIP ADVISOR, if it were not for you I would have not found such a great place. The bathroom was large and very clean, it had a bath with a shower and a wet room with a power shower and drench shower which was amazing and lit with mood lighting. The room was large and very comfortable, the TV picture was great (compared to other hotels) the view was limited but what I got was a quiet room as a result. Coming back late at night the road does tend to get blocked when they wash the streets of Madrid and the Taxi has to leave you at the end and you have to do a short walk which is completely safe. I think the mini bar should be free or cheaper like some other hotels, a small gripe as I am used to free mineral water and ice etc, but I am sure that may not be a problem for all reading this review. The balcony was a Juliet Balcony, some rooms have 2 (ask at reception) and provides lots of fresh air and is well sound proofed with 2 sets of doors. The air con was fantastic. The location was great. The breakfast was worth double the price they charge (enough said). As a Brit I found it very reassuring that at the time of stay many of the other guests were Spanish and I think this fact alone accounts for the excellent customer service and friendly reception staff as well as the quality of all the meals. The hotel is near some other (famous hotels) but I am really glad I choose this one. The reception staff were absolutely friendly (worth repeating from above) and could not have done more to assist. Madrid is a dream Live long and prosper.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, well appointed”
Reviews.Author: Alfisti1966
Reviews.Content: Nice small unpretentious hotel hidden away in a side street, although centrally located. Well appointed, clean, calm and restful. The rooms are nice for the money although you can't leave a window open as it is very noisy at night with revellers and in the morning with street cleaners. I would use again for business or pleasure. Oh, and the internet access (wireless, just ask at reception) is free, which is great as I object to paying for an hotel room and then being asked more to use the internet.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: popeye9
Reviews.Content: Very good, clean and efficient hotel.Well worth its 4 stars.Its location was right in the old town - excellent - and only a short walk to most places of interest. Our room was of a 5 star standard.Huge beds,top quality linen,excellent heating/ac and quality furnishings.Above all else was the entrance foyer to our room-bedroom on the right and a fantastic bathroom on the left.The power shower alone was as big as some hotel rooms. Although a small balcony was there,the sound - proofing excellent. Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “calm, quiet,peaceful,a charming oasis after the day”
Reviews.Author: marymce
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel. very civilised staff. thankyou for help printing out our boarding passes. will recommend hotel to all we know !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SMTORD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes for 4 nights last week, and could not have been more pleased with the location, room, staff, and amenities. We had planned a 10-night stay in Spain-- 3 nts in Madrid, 3 or 4 in Valencia, and then the remainder in Madrid again. The first three were at the Gran Melia Fenix (also reviewed), but we deliberately did not book the last part, not being sure how long we wanted to be in Valencia and whether we wanted to stay in a different part of Madrid upon our return. When we stopped by the Catalonia Las Cortes to check it out, we knew we wanted to stay there upon our return. Alia, at the front desk, had someone take us up to look at a room (one of the suites, which we requested), and said the hotel could be flexible about the dates, just to call them as soon as we knew. They were also very accommodating about keeping one of our bags until our return. The suite was wonderful-- enormous bed, two flat-screen TV's, lovely furnishings, and frescoed ceilings. Being on the 2nd floor, on the corner facing the P. del Prado, I was concerned about noise but we heard nothing.. even on the weekend. We really appreciated the thoughtful design of the room-- ample closets, electric sockets at the height of the desk, good lighting (with switches actually next to them!!!), extra pillows and blankets, and a shower curtain in addition to the usual "half- enclosure" of the bathtub that leaves the floor flooded when you shower. Free wireless is available in all the rooms, and it actually works-- really well and with no hassles. The housekeeping eveywhere in the hotel is immaculate, and we didn't experience any of the discinfectant smell noted by other reviewers. Room rates for the suites, as well as the other rooms we saw (which are quite large by European standards) are VERY reasonable. The breakfasts were great, and the waitstaff very helpful and accommodating. The entire staff at the front desk could not have been friendlier, or shown more genuine concern for their guets.. Two of the guests when we were there were both robbed on the metro from the airport, and then our bank blocked access to our ATM card. The front desk staff bent over backwards to help all of us (especially Alia and the tall gentleman who works nights at the desk). While the restaurant/room service menu is quite limited, it's only 100 meters to Plaza Santa Ana, and at least 50 tascas/bars/restaurants... enough of them open at all hours to alleviate hunger until the usual 9 PM opening time for many Madrid restaurants. We were very, very pleased with our stay and recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Still amoung the best hotels I know”
Reviews.Author: ontheqt
Reviews.Content: My requirements from a hotel are simple: 1) Location 2) Cleanliness 3) Comfort 4) Quiet Las Cortes ticks all of these requirements with excellence. I was worried that the room next to the cleaners would be noisy in the morning (like some hotels I've suffered) but even that was no problem. I believe part of this is due to the good room design - there is an inner lobby to each room to block out noise from outside and there are two sets of double glazing. I still feel that they should not charge for internet access - many hotels offer this for free but I will continue to use and recommed this hotel while it presents the same value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Catalonia las Cortes is located in the heart of Madrid's old city, a short walk from the Plaza de Angels, and adjacent to a wonderful area of clubs and restaurants. The hotel is a half-hour taxi ride from the airport (~ 30 euros) or a half hour by Metro (2 euros, two transfers to get to the Banco de Espana stop, then walk four blocks up the Calle de Prado. We didnt' see a car park and you really don't need a car to see Madrid. The hotel web site gave the best rates, but there are clear divisions between amenities given by the hotel. If you take their bargain rate, you will not get breakfast (15 euros a la carte) or morning newspapers: it seems a bit petty. The hotel is easy to find by its large sign, and the hotel staff quickly completed the checkin. The staff speaks excellent english. There are elevators up to the rooms, and easy handicap access. The rooms are large and comfortable: a big bed, minibar, safe, cabel television. There is free wireess internet, and the windows open to give a nice breeze. The adjacent buildings are close and people stay up (very) late: there is a lot of street noise until 4 am (closing the windows helps a lot). The bathroom is large and clean; there is very abundant hot water in the shower / tub. The hotel allows smoking in public areas, and people often do in the bar: request a non-smoking room if needed. The restaurant looks good, but 15 euro was steep for an unremarkable breakfast compared to surrounding restaurants: a continental breakfast can be found for 5 euro and a full breakfast for 10. The staff was helpful in securing reservations at local restaurants, and the staff is on-desk all night. This is a good hotel, nice rooms, and a very helpful staff, located in a great position for exploring Madrid with most major sites located within a 10-minute walk. The breakfast and newspaper policy is annoying, but there are lots of alternatives nearby. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Louise087
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week in Madrid. I stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes with my husband and three sons (aged 15, 13, 10). The hotel was fantastic value. The rooms are more spacious than most European rooms. The location of the hotel is sensational. The rooms are quiet and nicely appointed. The service and help provided by the staff outstanding. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetootrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes last April, and were very pleasantly surprised. We'd looked at the website, and the rooms are very well represented there. I asked for a room with a tub and lots of light, and my request was met with room number 408, which was perfect. It was high enough to have a view over the rooftops, and overlooked a quiet side street. I made notes (in preparation for this review): good lighting, hard bed (although we slept just fine!), a very nice closet with a safe, high ceiling with inset lighting, and a refrigerator. The bathroom was GREAT - a rain and hand shower, a deep soaking tub, heated towel bar, and lots of counter space. Bathroom lighting was fair, not great, but agin, not a problem for us. I had originally booked by calling the hotel, and was going to pay more, but I saw that by booking online we could spend less and breakfast would be included, so we ended up paying 181 €, which to me was a fantastic value. I thought that the restaurant was very well decorated, with thick linens on the tables, large florals, and an opaque window allowing light into the interior while affording privacy from the street. The breakfast was one of the most extensive we had anywhere, including breads and rolls, fritattas, cereals, yogurt, fruit, ham, cheeses, bacon, sausages, and fried eggs. Service in the restaurant (we also had a light snack one night) was wonderful. While we were grateful to the staff at the front desk for responding to our room request, I would not say that they were overly warm and friendly, but they were certainly cordial. The location is just perfect. We walked (in the rain) to the Prado, Reina Sofia, Puerta del Sol, etc. with no problems. Lots of great restaurants in the Plaza Santa Ana just a few short blocks away. One of our favorite meals was next door at Las Letras - small, great food! We would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The odd quirks are compensated by the space and the staff...”
Reviews.Author: Elithecat
Reviews.Content: Overall I agree with the positive reviews on the site, although as I write this in the lobby of the hotel, a maid is madly spraying a horrible smelling disinfectant in the air in order to cover a sort of sewer-y smell that is wafting through the dining room and the bar. While that may sound sort of off-putting (I mean: it *is* off-putting...), that smell isn't all that unusual in the center of many European cities, and I think it bothers Americans more than the locals. The highlights of this hotel are the very, very spacious rooms, which in my experience are quite unusual, even at higher-priced hotels in Madrid. When you're here working, the airy, high-ceiling look and the space to move around is so welcome that I'll make this my first choice when I return. As someone else mentioned, the beds are quite hard, but the pillows are soft. There's an excellent selection of newspapers in the lobby --all the Spanish papers, plus the Herald Tribune, the Financial Times and even Le Monde. But the place is quirky. The smell is weird; the question of whether or not your breakfast is included in the room price is a matter for discussion each day; and my room did not have a clock or a working telephone (I'm hoping that those little oversights solve the issue of whether or not I'm paying for my breakfast). As with many hotels, the (free) wireless Internet service is best in the lobby. The staff is *very* friendly and well-meaning, and is doing their best with the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe
Reviews.Content: We wanted to treat ourselves to a nice and reasonably priced hotel at the end of our two weeks travel from France to Spain and decided to settle at Catalonia Las Cortes. The hotel is very short distance from the train station and it's a 15 minutes walk. However, if you have luggages, highly suggest you take the cab BUT have the hotel arrange it for you. We got out of the station and took a cab in a nearby stand and when we told the cab driver where we were going, he started mumbling and looked sort of pissed off . Since the hotel is not located on one of the main street, it was hard to park and he almost kicked us out of the cab demanding the fare on the meter PLUS surcharge saying something like "too short of a trip and need to charge us more". He never got out of the car to help us with our luggage and we took our time but he started to swear (we knew since it's usually the first thing you learn in a foreign language) at us. Being we are New Yorkers, we could easily fight back without much fear, however, we let it go since we ARE in a foreign country. We decided to hold our tongue and told him to stop swearing. We told the concierge and she told us they could easily arrange a cab for us with more friendlier driver which they did for our trip to the airport. The hotel room is very spacious and clean with very comfortable bed. The breakfast is really the highlight of our days since it has a huge selection with great coffee to go with it. Just make sure you check the time since it's different between weekdays and weekends. The hotel is walking distance to a lot of places but you can take the Metro to a lot of places and it's very convenient. Madrid is really a city much like any other big city and has a huge nightlife. It's just so happened that we were there during the weekend of Blanco Noche when many of the museums in the city are opened 24 hours with free admissions and there were street performances until well into night. The local food scene is definitely one of the best in the world with many selections to chose from. We also took day trips outside of Madrid to Toledo, Saville and El Escorial which we thought were more charming than Madrid. Overall, the experience at Madrid was okay since it was just too much of a metropolis for us and missing the charm we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Location and personal service”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Hotel my company was going to book was full so I chose this hotel based on location and value Its got an excellent location, close to a nice square, with live music and good restuarants (it is about 100 metres from the square, but far enough to not have any noise issues) Excellent service from the guy on reception and the waitress, who patiently listened to any request I had Dont get me wrong, this is not a five star hotel. I asked for a quiet room and got a standard room overlooking the central stairwell. Rooms acceptable, nothing more, bed not hugely comfortable, but hey I was staying for 1 night and overall room was fine for my needs. I would probably look for a room upgrade, but on this occassion the hotels bosses were in town and must have booked the better rooms, which was a real shame...... Good Ham, nice cheap wine, friendly service thoughout, excellent check in, check out, easy to get a cab It is a small hotel, with no gym and small lobby/bar/restaurant area..... You do however have to see the main staircase - this has a huge charm in itself - like your walking into a different century - you'll know what I mean when you see it So much better than the likes of the inpersonal Melia chain of hotels, those huge monstrosities totally impersonal, overpriced, badly located, poor service and too big to care - so this hotel made a nice refreshing change from the norm

Reviews.Title: “Great Service/Best Shower”
Reviews.Author: Mickie
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Catalonia Las Cortes in Madrid. The staff are very friendly. My only complaint is they were not able to help me when I had trouble accessing their wireless internet service. The room was nice and was equipped with every amenity. The shower was fabulous -- had a huge shower head with amazing water pressure. Quite a treat. I did not have time for breakfast this time but recall that last time (a few months ago) the food was good and service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaquiboy
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a fine hotel. We didn't find the Madrilenos particularly warm, but when we disliked the first room they gave us (first floor with tow single beds out together) they were very accommodating and immediately gave us a nicer room on the 3rd floor. There was no noise from our room, and the room was impeccibly clean. The halls and the downstairs of the hotel have absolutely beautiful architecture. We were also very impressed with the bathroom--double showers and a tub. The TV had cable, but the English speaking CNN channel did not work as well. We never quite adjusted to Madrid time, and as a result only went to breakfast one day. It was delicious and te coffee was great. We are a married couple traveling without our children, and it was definitely worth the trip. Loved the neighborhood, too. Right around the corner from the Plaza Santa Ana, the Thyssen and the Prado and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimnick
Reviews.Content: This is a great 3 star hotel. It can not be a 4 star because if you walk down the hill to the Westin Palace that is a 5 star just one better and thus this is not a 4. It is a good three star and if you get the price of a 3 you have a great find. The issues are the total package. There is no lobby. The restaurant is an after thought in a town known for great food. A $20+ breakfast is basically a standard bacon sausage and amenitites buffet kept warm too long. The diunners are basic. The room choices vary from the magnificent 202 to a literal dungeon 03. I am not kidding a dungeon is a room with no real windows and it is dark all the time and it at the lowest point in the hotel thus room 03. So the ability to predict a great experience is based on what is available. If you are flying here from the USA you had better insist on a certain type of room as all of the good ones are gone by 1800. What makes it a great 3 star is the cleanliness, the location, walk to the Thyssen, the Prado the Archeologie Museos, the Botanical Gardens or the park. A quick tube stop to almost anywhere else. The bathrooms are all in marble and the floors are wood which is nice unless the person above you walks around in heals which then drives you crazy. The people are nice and helpful and the internet is free. So it is a great 3 star. There are no amenities other than the internet, so if you need a place to sleep and get a good rate and a nice choice of rooms you will feel like you are in heaven. If anyone of those does not happen you will feel sort of put off and if two do not happen you will wonder who those people are that wrote those glowing reviews. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fab shower/bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: littlemoth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter, sharing a twin room with a friend. Good sized comfortable room; great bathroom with bath and separate huge shower! Great location close to lots of bars and restaurants; close to shopping and the museums. Receptionist was very helpful and kindly let me practice my spanish and spoke slowly and clearly for me;) Only downside was at at breakfast; we arrived quite late one day (we hadn't prepaid) and were seated for about 5 minutes before the waiters cleared away all the food from the buffet! 11 finish is pretty prompt; would have been nice to be advised of this before we sat down at 10.55. But in the overall context it wasn't major, we didn't complain at the time and it wouldn't stop me staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mamacat58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. There were four of us in a triple room on the first floor. A triple room were 2 larger twin beds and one twin. The room (103) was spacious and clean. We had two terraces, tiny ones, but nevertheless two. One in the bathroom and one in the bedroom. Gorgeous bathroom, very large and clean. Outside the room was a beautiful hallway with couches and tables where we would go and have some wine, and just chit chat about the day. Staff were very nice and were very helpful in getting us reservations for a Flemenco restaurant, taxi cab to the airport and train directions to Segovia. It was situated a couple of blocks from Santa Anna, not far from Plaza de Mayor and within walking distance to the Prado, Reina Sofia and other major sites. I would recommend this hotel very highly. Great experience and great location. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Near To Everything”
Reviews.Author: Marita58
Reviews.Content: I stayed in ths hotel for 4 nights in January and although it was quiet because of the time of year, I would highly recommend it. The rooms were clean and spacious and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Is located quite centrally and you can walk everywhere with the help of a map from the desk, which the staff will help you with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: cwaggaman
Reviews.Content: I booked the Catalonia based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We stayed only one night at the end of a trip to southern Spain and Portugal, so I looked for a comfortable, well located hotel. The Catalonia Las Cortes more than met those expectations. The desk staff spoke excellent English and was young and genuinely friendly. The room was beautiful, with one of the nicest walk-in showers I have ever seen. My wife's only complaint was that there was only one small window and it was high up the wall and she said it made her feel a little claustrophobic. But the room was large, clean and comfortable. I noticed that prices have gone up- probably due to the current worthless U.S. dollar! So I wouldn't call the hotel a great value, but it is an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmygene
Reviews.Content: On our trip to Madrid in September 2007, we picked the Catalonia Las Cortes based on the glowing Trip Advisor reviews. For the most part, we were not disappointed. The hotel could not be in a better location, walking distance from the Prado and the Thyssen, It is also very close to the Plaza Santa Ana with its great restaurants. and entertaing night life. An added plus we discovered, was the Cafe Central Jazz Club and the Casa Patas Flamenco Cafe, both within two blocks of the hotel. The hotel was very clean and beautifully decorated. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. We did experience one minor problem which should have been easily remedied. The wash basin in the bathroom did not drain properly. It took four days and a personal visit to the hotel manager to finally have repairs , which took five minutes, made. Also, we did not find the desk staff to be very knowledgable or helpful. Bottom line, however,if we are ever in Madrid again, we will stay at the Las Cortes,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DramaGuy
Reviews.Content: Great location! We had easy walks to several art museums, including the Prado, the Palace, and several good restaurants. The Cuban restaurant, El Tocororo, is merely steps away from the front door. The staff were friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Rooms were very clean, with excellent bathrooms. They had a lounge area and a restaurant downstairs which provided a full breakfast. I would recommend this hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Loced Las Cortes”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Las Cortes is in a great location--10 minutes' walk to the Prado and Thyssen museams, 15 minutes to the Queen Sofia museam, and 2 minutes to Plaza Sanata Ana (with tons of tatpas bars.) Pros: --the most helpful front desk team (especailly Cesar and Luka) I have encountered in Spain --wonderful linens, towel warmer, and huge marbel showers with dual showerheads --small balconies with French doors (double windows for noise control) --room thermostats which really work well --great location (see above) --good buffet breakfast with cheeses, meats, spanish tortillas, bread/patries, juices, yogurt Cons: --despite double-glazing, street noise is an issue on weekends (can last until 4:00am) --design is more grandma-chintz than cool minimalist --it costs 2 Euro for 10 minutes on the lobby computer

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Manuel
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel with double glazed windows in an excellent location: near the charming Plaza Sta Ana, you can easily walk to the Prado and the Thyssen. The room was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility and location”
Reviews.Author: MikieSimon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Real up the street in a smaller room for more money and all we got there was slightly better style (and clientele) but you can't fold that! This is an excellent deal in an excellent location. Marble baths and tub, ultimate convenience and comfort for an extremely reasonable price in the best district in town. Superlative.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: MollyBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: We would return to this hotel without hesitation. Our room was on the second floor; a corner room with two large windows -- and a large comfortable Queen size bed. The modern marble bathroom was spacious as hotel baths go, and the shower pressure was terrific with plenty of hot water. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. The breakfast was included in the rate, and provided an excellent variety from fruit through eggs, sausage, potato tortillas, etc. I asked for tea, two mornings, and they brought an individual tea pot to the table. As other reviews stated, you can't beat the location. We walked to the Prado, and Retiro Park and felt safe walking at night beyond Santa Ana Square, through the streets and other Squares in the Old Madrid area. The tapas bars were lively at night, and a fun scene. We booked very early, and got an excellent value. Our four nights rate was $255. USD per night including tax. We considered it a bargain, given the quality of our stay and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some problems.”
Reviews.Author: JESVancouver_B_C_
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was really looking forward to my 5-day stay but was disappointed. Many reviewers stayed in rooms with stained glass and frescoes on the ceiling. That was not what I had on the top floor. While the room was spacious there was a tiny window too high to see out of and covered by a drape in need of repair. The breakfast was great with a good selection but you had a sense that staff was watching you to be sure you didn't go back too many times. Witnessed an argument between staff and someone who wanted a capuccino rather than the poor coffee that was available. All in all the staff were efficient but not very friendly. The location was excellent however, Just off the Plaza Santa Ana with all of its Tapas bars and action, yet far enough away re: noise. It was also a short walk to the Prado and Thyssen Museums. All in all it was OK but I had a better stay two weeks earlier at the Preciados for a better price even considering the included breakfast at Las Cortes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grockle69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for a long weekend having seen all the reviews. The hotel location is excellent and very central. The rooms are great and the shower is of the type you would expect in a 5 star hotel. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast had lots of choice and was always of a good standard. Just down the road is Plaza de Santa Ana. where there are plenty of Tapas bars. Cannot think of anything negative to say about this Hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellefante
Reviews.Content: Relaxing and very nice stay. Very helpfull people. Very clean. Location near Santa Ana was very convenient for me!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssKaySydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel CLC for 2 nights in Sept , very comfy , great location, elegant decor, great staff who spoke perfect English. A little overpriced, but if money is not a problem highley recommended. Spent the next 5 nights at the Hotel Liabeny about 10 minutes walk towards Puerta del Sol, in my opinion this hotel was just as good ( a little older maybe) and half the price at 130 Euros per night with buffet brekky, that is the go if you want to save some bucks. Liabeny is on Calle Sud of Puerta Del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davcam
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel. The location is fabulous, located at Plaza Santa Ana, almost equal walking distance between Plaza Mayor and the Prado Museum, about 10 minutes or so each way. The rooms are elegant, the bathrooms terrific. We had a deluxe room which was very large but a bit expensive. My guess is that the standard rooms are smaller. The staff was great, made every effort to help and spoke English as well as they could. Cesar was particularly helpful. The hotel stored our excess luggage for us at no cost for five nights between our stays there. We were there a total of six nights and plan to return. I thought the breakfast was very nice as well. My only concern is that the bed was the hardest we experienced in Spain. That could be an issue for some travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews I had read. I wasn't at all disappointed in my room which not only had a large bedroom and shower room (with 2 showers!) but also had a separate hallway with wardrobe and personal safe. The room was very clean and comfortable. The only downside was that it looked on to an inner courtyard and so there was very little natural light. The staff were very pleasant but few spoke English. I ate in the hotel restaurant on two occasions because I was in Madrid on my own. The food was quite poor - not well cooked and not particularly good quality. I got the impression dining in the restaurant wasn't encouraged as it was very quiet. The breakfast buffet was fine with a good range of hot and cold foods. The location of the hotel is excellent, quiet but central, close to the museums and galleries. I would definitely stay here again but I would eat out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JB_Parrothead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in mid-September 2007. We liked everything about this place. Our room was smartly appointed and large enough for 2 travelers with separate luggage. Our bath had a free standing shower and a tub/shower combo which was a plus. We booked a standard double room at 162 euros which included breakfast; the rooms had 2 twin beds, a desk, separate entry room, flat screen TV and 2 closets. This hotel doesn't offer a view but it is so conveniently located just between Plaza Santa Ana and the Prado Museum that you are literally within minutes of many of the major attractions. We had drinks almost nightly in one of the many cafe/bars in Plaza Santa Ana. Also, just 1 minute from the hotel are 2 self-service laundries. I can definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who counts cleanliness, nice beds & pillows, location and price as important factors when choosing a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: PC6789
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay at the Catalonia Las Cortes mainly becuase of its excellent reviews and ratings on TripAdvisor which we have usually found quite dependable in the past. Unfortunately we found the hotel to be quite an ordinairy 4 star. The staff were OK; the breakfast was OK; the bedroom was OK; the location was OK. We ate just once in the hotel's own restaurant and that was quite a let down given the price. The food was obviously from some pre-prepared system such as cook/freeze and whist edible was not an occasion to savour. We noticed that throughout our six nights there the hotel restaurant was hardly used in the evenings by any of the guests. So the whole experience was OK but nothing more. We have stayed in far better 4 star hotels on visits to Spanish cities. Would we sta there again? No. Would we recommend anyone else to stay? We'd say it's 'OK' but there must be somewhere better for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Fields of Athenry
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on basis of Trip Advisor Reviews and were not disappointed. The room price which included breakfast was great value for Madrid particularly in this very central location. The room was spacious and extremely clean-a bonus was the free in room wifi (only expected it in the public areas). The service was very good at all times, the staff at reception spoke excellent English and were eager to be helpful, and the breakfast was more than adequate and very well presented. Have stayed previously in 4 other Hotels in Madrid-next time will be coming back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Brid1
Reviews.Content: I booked directly with the hotel having read all the reviews on the site. Other websites were much more expensive - the day before we travelled however it was much cheaper on Expedia!
