We took a taxi from the airport, it was hot and we didn't feel like battling our way on the metro. It cost 30Euro. We had booked 3 rooms, the keys didn't work in one room and another was tiny. Both problems were dealt with efficiently. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and bathrooms are great. My only gripe was there seemed to be a definite staff shortage - breakfast service was erratic - I had to ask several times for coffee and I noticed other guests becoming slightly annoyed by this too. The day we checked out there was a 40 minute wait to check out - one member of staff attending to everyone's needs was not enough. Lots of lovely places to eat and drink and watch the world go by. Had one bad experience where the waiter offered to bring tapas for 7 - what followed was a banquet that he knew we could not possibly eat! I was very annoyed and he finally reduced the bill, slightly! The Room Mate hotel next door had a fantastic restaurant serving a set menu tapas lunch. We ordered the one for 3 and had more than enough food. Maybe we are just small eaters. Bus tour to be recommended and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: InkwotaBeru
Reviews.Content: We picked Las Cortes based on its tripadvisor rating/reviews and were not disappointed! The staff were lovely, the breakfast was great (served until 11am on weekends!) and the room and bathroom were spacious and spotless. The mini cafe inside the hotel lobby was a nice bonus! The hotel is 30 seconds from one of the main squares which has some nice outdoor cafe/restaurants, also very close to the art galleries (Reina Sofia within walking distance down the hill) and the Anton Martin metro stop. Everything we wanted to see/do was within 2-3 metro stops, so very convenient. If you're looking for cutting edge decor the Room Mate Alicia might be for you - we walked by it on several occasions as it is close by Las Cortes and the lobby features some interesting "art"! But if you're happy with traditional elegance, we'd definitely recommend Las Cortes for a relaxing and charming stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_to_eat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with an excellent location. I was really impressed both with the staff and the room itself: far beyond my expectations. The hotel staff spoke English and were eager to offer help and advise on everything from late night dinner, taxis to the airport, and electrical converters. I want to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: ics
Reviews.Content: Wonderful all around. Beautifully appointed hotel in central (yet quiet) location. Superb staff, free internet, excellent breakfast and super comfortable beds. Our best stay in Spain. Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: TraderCA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location at a most reasonable price. The rooms were decent size and had all the amenities needed. The hotel was clean and the staff very accommodating. Free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: radar0976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Catalonia Las Cortes for 2 nights and found it absolutely great. We found it a little difficult to find at first seeing as it about a 10 min walk from Sol Metro and you have to take quite a few turns to find it. The reception area is probably the least impressive thing about hotel. It's perfectly fine and functional and I would have no complaints about it. But for such a wonderful hotel the reception area does not do it justice seeing as it is just average. I would not count this as a fault though. Our check in was perfect. The staff throughout our stay were very friendly and helpful. The room itself was beautiful. A nice mix of old and new. The building is a converted palace evidently. Some of the rooms (not ours) have the original painted ceilings. The bed was big and comfortable and the bathroom was spotless, classy and had a lovely powerful shower. The air-con (unlike many other hotels I've stayed in in Spain) actually worked perfectly and made sleeping very comfortable at night. The location of the hotel is only a few steps from Plaza St. Anna which is the main square for eating out and is surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafes where you can get some amazing food for good prices. All in all a lovely stay at Catalonia Las Cortes. No complaints at all. Rooms are lovely and quiet too. Because you have two sets of doors to the room balcony any street noise outside is totally blocked out.

Reviews.Title: “elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: PatMedart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has lovely elegant rooms. It is very convienant to nightlife. Nice breakfast included with a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Hoped For!”
Reviews.Author: emilyBSW
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a 24-hour layover in Madrid. We wanted a chance to see the city, with a restful night's sleep. We were very surprised by the excellence of the hotel. For the price $260, we had just that. The location is excellent-within walking distance to everything you'd want to see. The hotel is on the smaller side, so it has an intimate feel. The concierge was incredibly helpful on a number of different things, including suggestions for restaurants and tours. The rooms were very comfortable, and bathrooms amazing. And, especially for Americans used to larger breakfasts, the free breakfast buffet was very satisfactory. I would highly recommend this hotel for any and all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyLondon
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel, perfect location, close to everything you need to see and do. We were given an upgrade as our room door was faulty, there was no hesitation, we were upgraded immediately, on the fourth floor in a superior room. Massive bed, lots of space and stylish decor. It was 5 star standard. The bathroom was wonderful, lots of green marble and good fittings. The staff were more than helpful, telling us about bars, booking resaurants and always helpful and friendly. I can't fault this hotel and if you're travelling to Madrid give it a try, you wont be dissapointed. Madrid is a great city, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimSW3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, modern, and in a great location just walking distance from the Prado and other great attractions, and blocks from a Metro station if you need to go outside the city...I definitely would stay again! Kim P

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: c9avs
Reviews.Content: We, (a group of 40 something ladies) stayed at the Catalonia Las Cortes in May 2007 to celebrate one of our friends' BIG birthday. I booked this hotel after failing to secure a reservation for the Gran Canarias, and we were not disappointed. I had researched the Las Cortes on trip advisor and found the reports to be very accurate. The trip from the airport took about 20-30 minutes depending on the taxi driver. It would appear that they all model themselves on Schummacher! Don't sit in the front seat if you are of a nervous disposition. The meter was running, but at the end of the trip this was "adjusted". For 3 or 4 in a cab it seems that the going rate is €30, which is not too bad considering the entertainment en route! On arrival at the hotel, check-in was relatively painless once the two young men on reception worked out the room permutations. We booked the standard rooms, of which there were slight variations. Ask for a room overlooking the courtyard as they are slightly bigger and probably quieter. The rooms are on the small side compared to some other European cities but have very comfy beds, nice marble bathrooms, all the usual toiletries and a good hairdryer (you did need a strong thumb though!).Breakfast was included which was good with a selection of cooked, healthy i.e fresh fruits, juices and muesli and also cold meats, cheeses and even chocolate cake! The hotel is in an ideal location for most of the main tourist attractions, i.e. Palacio Real, Plaza Major, Puerta Del Sol, Prado (closed Mondays, free entry Sundays but large queue) Thyssen, El Rastro & Retiro Park. All were within easy walking distance. The Plaza St Ana is a 2 minute stroll up the street and is a great place to spend time over a jug of sangria or tapas in the evening. It does get very busy Fri/Sat with tables at a premium, so going out early i.e. before 10 pm is a good idea. We ate just off the square at La Fragua De Vulcano. Good raciones (large tapas) but the music is a bit on the loud side. Vinoteca Bibicheria in Pl. St. Ana is a good tapas bar/restaurant but as you can't book, finding a table at the weekend is hard. Think the favourite place had to be El Buschon 5 minutes north east of Pl.St. Ana. Excellent pork and meatballs. Everything is in Spanish but half the fun is decifering the menu & guesswork! It was all good. We enjoyed Madrid very much with the location and standard of the hotel adding to this greatly. I would recommend the Las Cortes as an ideal base for a Madrid stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: Artemis-Angel
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel excellent service, great room and convenient location. I had booked a single room but had a lovely large room with king size bed. The staff were polite and helpful. An excellent breakfast spread including cooked breakfast. Nice lounge and bar area. With walking distance of the Prado (and other museums) and the Royal Palace, near Sol metro station which makes it very easy if you wish to go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Judy26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in late April/May 2007--two nights at the beginning of our trip to Spain and the last night before our return to the U.S. We were traveling with adult children and required three rooms. The hotel has an intimate, cozy ambience with a small lobby and bar area. The staff working at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. After traveling in the south of Spain, we were happy to return once again to this hotel which felt like home in Madrid. Our rooms were definitely the largest we have occupied in Europe or Asia. On our last night there, my husband and I were upgraded to a junior suite with the largest bed I've ever seen--much larger than a king. The bathrooms were marble and had both a walk-in shower with excellent water pressure and a bathtub with shower. Each room also had beautiful tray ceilings, although minus the murals shown in the hotel photos. The hotel has maintained the large, beautiful staircase which was a part of the original structure. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast. An excellent buffet selection of fruit, eggs, meat, and pastries was offered. Internet was available in the lobby next to the bar for a fee. The front desk staff was exceptionally helpful in dealing with problems we had with a booking in Seville. Yazid and Vanessa were uncomplaining in their efforts to assist us and always cheerful. Danny was also exceptionally pleasant. All three spoke excellent English. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to future travelers. It is within easy walking distance to the Prado, Reina Sofia, and Thyssen musuems, as well as Retiro Park and the shopping areas of Gran Via and Sol. Just off Santa Ana Plaza, it is a perfect location for visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: birthdayoys
Reviews.Content: Party of 8 have just spent 4 nights in this wonderful hotel celebrating a 60th birthday. Tastefully refurbished and spotlessly clean. Plenty of food for beakfast. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Would stay at this hotel again if in Madrid as it is in walking distance of a metro station and old town attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem and close to all you want to see in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sharonlovesspain
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful hotel-finished to a high standard. If you don't want to stay in a hi tech hotel (of which there are many in Madrid) and prefer a bit of old Spain - stay here.! The rooms are very comfortable with a beautifully done separate bathroom. Ours had a walk in shower room- very luxurious for a 4 star and air conditioning- which we did need in Feb as hotel was a bit too hot for us. This hotel is surrounded by great little bars and resturants- stay off Santa Ana for value and is walking distance to all the other major points of interest.(musems, Sol,La Latina, Plaza Mayor,Palacio Real, Gran Via)). We didn't get the metro once. Madrid is fabulous and I hope to return when the weather is warmer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a bit of style and comfort. The value was brillant- room B&B per night was 99euro- a bargain. I've don't have any photos but I would say that the hotel web site photos do not do this Hotel justice. Also this is a safer area than say- Sol and the Gran Via-where I saw an attempt at pic-pocketing etc at night time. Be careful where you stay in this city. We're glad we stayed on Calle del Prado at this hotel and will stay here again!!

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Las Cortes
HotelInfo.Address: Calle del Prado 6, 28014 Madrid, Spain
